loans.name: Yesu Yakola Group

texts.en:
This group is located in Kyotera town, Rakai district. Members in the group do different activities.

Janat is a single mother of four children aged 17, 15, 13 and 7 years, of whom only two go school. She is a 'matooke' (green banana) seller, a business which she started in 2012.

She does this activity along a busy road and her clients come from Kyotera town and those traveling out of the town. She started the business so as to boost her income base. The challenge with her business is transport especially during the rainy season where the roads are slippery and impassable.
Janat wants to buy herself a plot of land and build a residential house.

loans.use: To buy a plot of land

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a mobile phone, solar charging set, and weighing scale so that she may provide vital farming information to her community.

loans.name: Nafissatou's Group

texts.fr: Ce groupe est constitué de 4 femme est créé depuis la création de son Banc Villageois le 22 mars 2001. du fait de la bonne progression des membres en épargne et en crédit. Madame Nafissatou qui est à la droite de la photo levant la main est la représentante du groupe. Elle est âge de 43 ans. Elle est veuve et mère de trois enfants dont un garçon. Elle est très expérimentée dans ce domaine d'activité pour l'avoir pratiqué depuis plusieurs années. Le prêt sollicité servira à acheter 25 pièces de tissus teintés qu'elle va revendre à domicile par un système de vente à crédit. Les bénéfices générés par l'activité serviront à la prise en charge des frais de scolarité des enfants.
texts.en:
This group of 4 women was established at the same time as their Banc Villageois, on March 22, 2001, because the members have made excellent progress in terms of savings and loans. 

The group's representative is Nafissatou, who is raising her hand on the right in the photo. She is 43 years old, widowed, and the mother of three children, including one son. 

Nafissatou benefits from several years of experience in this domain. The requested loan will allow her to buy 25 lengths of dyed fabric that she will re-sell on credit from her home. The income generated by this business will be used to pay for her children’s schooling.

loans.use: to buy dyed fabric.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more pigs and start growing fruit

loans.name: Jorge

texts.en:
When Jorge moved to the US from Venezuela four years ago, he immediately set his entrepreneurial skills to work. He created his own business selling ice cream and hot dogs as a street vendor, and has been steadily growing his profits over the years. A five-time repeat borrower in good standing with the Intersect Fund, Jorge has seen the benefits of micro-loans on his business.

With this loan, Jorge will purchase a new vending cart, so that he can expand his venture.

loans.use: To purchase a new vending cart for thriving hot dog business

loans.name: Frank Eric

texts.en: Frank is a Cameroonian aged 38 who is not married and does not have a child. He has been in this business for over two years which makes him experienced and stable. He is likely to succeed because his business is located in an urban area which gives him many potential customers. This loan will help him increase his profits by 50 % and his standard of living will increase as well.

loans.use: to buy fruit and vegetables to resell.

loans.name: Kholmat

texts.ru: Этого начинающего бизнесмена зовут Холмат. Ему 34 года. Он женат и проживает с женой и детьми в районе Шахритус. Его жена дома занимается шитьем. Сам Холмат работает мастером по ремонту домов. С наступлением холодов Холмат остается без заказов и естественно без источника дохода. Поэтому он хочет параллельно начать новый бизнес по купле и продаже крупнорогатого скота. У него при дворе дома имеется коровник, а также запас 200 вязок высушенной кукурузной травы. Он запрашивает кредит, чтобы закупить двух молодых бычков хорошей породы. Холмат планирует откармливать бычков в течение 30-35 дней и выводить на продажу на местный рынок. Благодаря данному кредиту Холмат будет обеспечен прибыльным бизнесом.
texts.en:
This aspiring businessman's name is Kholmat.  He is 34 years old, married, and lives with his wife and children in the Shahrituz region of Tajikistan.  His wife busies herself with sewing at home, while Kholmat works as a home repair contractor.  As winter draws near, Kholmat has been getting fewer and fewer clients, and has been earning less as a result, which is why he's decided he'd like to start up his own cattle-selling business.  He already has a cow barn at his house, and also has 200 bundles of hay on hand made from corn stalks.  

He is seeking a loan to buy a couple of young bulls for his business.  He plans on fattening the bulls for around 30-35 days, then selling them at a local market.  With the help of this loan, Kholmat will have the makings of a profitable business.

loans.use: buy 2 young bulls of good pedigree.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase increased amounts of maize, thus aiding her in improving her overall sales.

loans.name: Los Mangos Group

texts.es: “Los mangos” es un grupo ubicado en la comunidad de Santa Rosa de Lima una comunidad con muchos árboles sus habitantes son personas muy alegres, trabajadoras pero sobretodo emprendedoras casi nunca tienen tiempo para otras actividades porque siempre están ocupados en sus negocios. Porque ellos no querían tener un nombre común y como el nombre de flores o plantas son muy repetitivas decidieron buscar  un nombre de frutas y se les ocurrió mangos. Doña Amanda tiene 52 años de edad está casada con el señor Rubén desde hace 30 años juntos han formado una familia con cuatro hijos  que ya no dependen de dicha pareja, Doña Amanda se dedica a la cría y engorda de cerdos para su venta desde hace ya 15 años tiene una muy buena estructura para tener muchos cerdos hasta el momento tiene 40 cerdos muy bien nutridos. Esta vez está solicitando un crédito a VisionFund y KIVA para comprar alimento para sus cerdos que tiene en su casa, Doña Amanda nunca compra cerdos de otras personas, sus mismas cerdas nacen cerditos chicos y son los que se encarga de crecer y engordar para después vender con un comprador fijo quien se dedica  hacer carnitas todos los días también con otro cliente en el municipio su venta es segura. Doña Amanda comento “No tengo ninguna dificultad porque desde pequeña tuve la experiencia de criar estos animales, es una actividad heredada por mis padres”.  El sueño de Doña Amanda es poder llegar a tener mas saudas para tener más cerdos siempre le ha gustado tener animales y no quisiera dejar de criar porque de alguna manera con sus ganancias ayuda a su esposo  con los gastos del hogar. Así como Doña Amanda esta agradecida con su crédito también el resto del grupo para invertir en sus negocios Lucia, Placida invertirá en tortillas, Nayeli y Brigida invertirán en el alimento para sus cerdos, José Juan invertirá en pollos, Martha en flores.
texts.en:
Los Mangos is a group that is located in the Santa Rosa de Lima community.  It is a community with a lot of trees.  Its inhabitants are very happy people who are hard-working, and, above all, they are entrepreneurs who almost never have time for other activities.  This is because they are always busy with their businesses.  

They did not want to have a common name, and because flower or plant names are very repetitive, they decided to look for a fruit name, and mangos occurred to them.

Amanda, age 52, has been married to Rubén for 30 years.  Together they have formed a family with four children, who are no longer dependent upon the couple.  Amanda has been raising and fattening pigs to sell for 15 years.  She has a very good structure for having a lot of pigs.  To date she has 40 very well-fed pigs.

This time she is requesting a loan from VisionFund and Kiva to buy feed for her pigs that she has at her house.  Amanda never buys pigs from other people.  Her own pigs give birth to little pigs, and those are the ones she raises and fattens to later sell to a fixed buyer.  The buyer makes carnitas every day.  She also sells to another customer in the municipality, and her sale is assured.

Amanda states, “I don’t have any difficulty because I have had the experience of raising these animals ever since I was little.  It is a business activity that I inherited from my parents”.  Amanda’s dream is to be able to have a more money in order to have more pigs.  She has always liked having animals, and she would not like not raising them.  This is because, with her income, she helps her husband with the household expenses.

Amanda is grateful for her loan.  The rest of the group is also grateful to invest in their businesses.  Lucia and Placida will buy tortillas, Nayeli and Brigida will buy feed for their pigs, José Juan will buy chickens, and Martha will buy flowers.

loans.use: to buy feed for her pigs.

location.town: SanTa Rosa de Lima El oro

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to increase her current inventory levels, hence allowing her to sell greater quantities of groceries.

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en:
Imelda is widowed with five children. Imelda is 49 years old and lives in Upper Centro, Tudela, Philippines.

Imelda is a farmer and raises pigs to earn a living. She has been doing this for five years. She has requested a loan to purchase additional feeds and other agrivet supplies.

Imelda has been a member of PMPC for six years. In the future, Imelda hopes to save for some emergencies.

loans.use: to purchase additional feeds and other agrivet supplies.

loans.name: Annelyn

texts.en: Annelyn is a single entrepreneur who has run her business for more than a year. She sells cosmetic products and homemade sausage in her community in addition to farming. She borrowed a loan from GDMPC microcredit to buy more cosmetic products and homemade sausage to resell. This photo was taken outside her parents' house beside their farm. She is hopeful of generating additional revenue and saving money to build her own house in the near future.

loans.use: to buy more cosmetic products and homemade sausage to resell

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en:
Rosalinda is 38 years old and married with three children.

Rosalinda works hard to provide for her family. She runs a business buying and selling charcoal in the Philippines and requested a PHP 19,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional charcoal to sell.

Rosalinda has borrowed and paid back ten loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the business buying and selling charcoal for five years and also earns an income from buying and selling dried coconut.

Rosalinda aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional charcoal to sell

loans.name: Betty

texts.en:
Betty is 52 years old, married, and has five children. She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines, which she has been doing for three years.  She earns additional income from raising pigs.

Betty is requesting a loan from NWTF for 15,000 PHP, which she will use to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies. She hopes to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Yemma

texts.en:
Yemma is 35 years old, married with one kid who is in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. 

Yemma has a food-vending business in the Philippines. Yemma requested a PHP 9,500 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy ingredients for her food business.

Yemma has been in this business for five years. In the future, Yemma would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food business.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is 58 years old, married with five children, one of whom is in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Teresita has a food production business in the Philippines. Teresita requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy utensils and ingredients for her food business.

Teresita has been in this business for four years. In the future, Teresita would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy utensils and ingredients for her food business.

loans.name: Nohn

texts.en:
Nohn is 47 years old, and she has been living in Sanniquellie, the capital city of Nimba County which is rich in natural resources. Living conditions there are much better than in the capital city of Liberia, and it is the second most populated county in Liberia. 

Nohn did not go to school. She has five children between 11 and 30 years old; only two are in school and live at home. With a  little money from her mother, she was able to establish her business in 2009. She has been running a small local shop where she sells onions, oil, salt, etc in the local market. She spends 9 hours each day on her business, from Monday to Saturday. A problem she faces is inadequate income; she is requesting a loan to purchase more onions, oil, salt, etc. for her business. Her plan is to one day to build a modern house.

loans.use: to purchase more onions, oil, salt, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase increased amounts of yams, thus aiding her to improve her overall sales.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase increased amounts of cassava, thus aiding her to improve her overall sales.

loans.name: Lorena

texts.en:
Lorena is widow who has three adult children who help her in her farm. Aside from making money from their coconut farm, she also has a vegetable plot from which she earns a little amount weekly as an aid to their monthly income. 

She borrowed a loan from GDMPC micro-credit to buy new variety of vegetable seeds and fertilizer. She is determined to have more income and hopes to have another plot with a new variety of vegetables. She hopes that in the near future, she will earn well enough to improve the general living conditions of the family.

loans.use: to buy a new variety of vegetable seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Rhea

texts.en:
Rhea is 37 years old and married, with four children.

Rhea works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines, and she has requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to buy more stocks of groceries to sell.

Rhea has borrowed and repaid seven loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running her general store for four years, and she also earns an income from food vending.

Rhea aspires to save money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase stocks of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
As the married parent of seven children, Lucy works hard to support her family.

She has a food-vending business in the Philippines, and she also earns income from fattening pigs. 

Lucy is borrowing PHP 29,500 through NWTF to buy more ingredients like bananas, cooking oil, sugar, etc., for her food-vending business.

Lucy has sustained her business activities through her past 22 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more ingredients like bananas, cooking oil, sugar, etc

loans.name: Mary Grace

texts.en:
Mary Grace is 44 years old and married with four children.

She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. Mary Grace is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF in order to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies.

Mary Grace has been farming rice for eight years and earns additional income from raising pigs.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream, to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Ushindi Group

texts.fr: La cliente Bulambo est une présidente du groupement de crédit « Ushindi », jeune entrepreneur expérimentée, dynamique, âgée de 35 ans et mère de 6 enfants qui étudient tous. Son conjoint un enseignant. La cliente est  une vendeuse des souliers.  Elle installe ses articles  au marché public. Elle commença ses affaires avec  l’assistance de son mari. Plus tard, elle bénéficia le  prêt de l’IMF Hekima. Il y a 15  ans qu’elle exerce cette activité. Ce nouveau prêt va lui servir d’acheter 2 ballons des souliers.  Ainsi, elle souhaite scolariser ses enfants, étendre son projet de commerce et construire une jolie maison. Les vols, les impayés, les pertes de change sont de défis pour le développement de son activité. Au finish, elle remercie fortement Hekima pour l’autonomisation des femmes entrepreneurs non bancables, surtout ; pendant ce moment critique de guerre à l’Est du pays.
texts.en:
Bulambo is the president of the “Ushindi” borrowing group. She is an experienced and dynamic young entrepreneur, who is 35 years old and has 6 children, all of whom attend school. Her husband is a teacher. 

Bulambo has been selling shoes for 15 years, displaying her merchandize in the public market. She began her business with help from her husband. Later, she received a loan from the microfinance institution Hekima. She will use this new loan to buy 2 bales of shoes. She hopes this will allow her to send her children to school, to expand her business and to build a lovely house. 

The expansion of her business is hindered by theft, unpaid debts and losses. In closing, she is extremely grateful to Hekima for enabling the empowerment of women who don’t have access to traditional banking, especially during this critical time of conflict in the Eastern part of the country.

loans.use: acheter 2 ballons des souliers.

loans.name: Enriliza

texts.en:
Enriliza is 39 years old and married with one child.

Enriliza works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stock to sell, such as canned goods, milk, sugar, soap, shampoo, etc.

Enriliza has borrowed and paid back 2 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 4 years and also earns an income from buying and selling charcoal.

Enriliza aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional stock to sell in her general store

loans.name: Clarissa

texts.en:
As a married mother of one child, Clarissa works hard to support her family.

She has a food vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store. Clarissa is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to purchase more ingredients to sell in her food vending business.

Clarissa has sustained her business activities through her past 6 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more ingredients to sell

loans.name: Manu

texts.en:
It seems only natural for Manu to manage his own information technology company. With several years of experience in consulting, managing, designing and developing business and system applications, Manu knows the industry in and out. He has worked in various industries, from banking and finance to manufacturing, and for international organizations such as General Electric (GE), Proctor & Gamble (P & G), J.P. Morgan Chase and Verizon Wireless.

Made up of around twelve employees and freelancers, Manu’s team caters to mid-sized companies with limited budgets that are looking for affordable IT solutions. His company offers a wide range of services, including web hosting and design, telecom services and more. Networking, hardware and software are some of their products.

The funds from this loan will assist Manu in expanding his business and moving from a leased to an owned space. Manu hopes to build greater visibility by moving to this independent building, and to build more contact relationships with neighborhood businesses.

loans.use: to move an experienced information technology (IT) company into its own space.

loans.name: Elida

texts.en:
Elida is 30 years old and she is now applying for a loan of $1,200 to improve her business. 

She is married and has seven children. She opened her kiosk in 2000 with her own working capital of $100. She earns a good income from her business.
 
She will use her loan to buy some stock to keep in her store, such as shirts, long pants, shorts, long and short sleeved tops, childrens clothes and adult clothes. 

She is a very hard working woman and this business has been her regular activity for the past 13 years. She wants to make her business bigger and improve her living conditions in the future.

loans.use: to buy clothes to sell

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
As a married mother of four children, Gina works hard to support her family.

She has a trisikad transportation business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from pig fattening. Gina is borrowing PHP 5,500 through NWTF in order to buy spare parts for her trisikad.

Gina has sustained her business activities through her previous six loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for her trisikad.

loans.name: Meliza

texts.en:
Meliza is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a business buying and selling goods in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 29,500 through NWTF to buy additional items to sell for her business.

Meliza has been in this business for 7 years. Meliza also earns income from raising pigs.

Meliza has sustained her business activities through her own efforts with the help of loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell

loans.name: Pedro Sanchez

texts.en:
Originally from Peru, Pedro moved to Elizabeth, New Jersey in 1994. He has been working with computers since he was 18 years old, but started his own computer repair business five years ago.

Though he has never attended college, Pedro prides himself on being self-taught, by reading various technical books and independently practicing his skills. He even went to Peru for a specialized training in welding and computer repair. Pedro invests not only in his technical skills, but his business ones; he realizes the importance of actively learning English and takes classes to improve his language skills.

Pedro likes to repair computers, but more than that, he enjoys helping the people in his community. He wants to offer an affordable service, and he has successfully done so, building his customer base to a substantial 4,000 people.

Pedro’s dream is to open his own store, fixing and reselling computers in Elizabeth. The funds from this loan will be used for rent for the store, for supplies, such as a table and monitor, and for advertising the new location.

loans.use: to cover the rent for the store, purchase of supplies, and advertising for his computer repair business.

loans.name: Myra

texts.en:
Myra is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a food-vending business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 29,500 through NWTF to purchase additional stocks of ingredients for her food-vending business.

Myra has been in this business for 38 years. Myra earns additional income from a beauty parlor.

Myra has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks of ingredients.

loans.name: Beverly

texts.en:
Beverly is 41 years old and married with five children.

She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. Beverly is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies.

Beverly has been farming rice for 10 years and also earns additional income from a general store.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies

loans.name: Letecia

texts.en:
Letecia is 61 years old and married with three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Letecia has a hardware business in the Philippines. Letecia requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more hardware stock for her store.

Letecia has been in this business for twenty years. In the future, Letecia would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more hardware stock for her store.

loans.name: Esterlita

texts.en:
Esterlita is married and has 3 children. She is 50 years old and resides at Dinas, Sinacaban, Philippines. 

She manages a farm, planting vegetables as an aid to her husband's income, also from farming. 

Her previous loan from GDMPC was used for farm inputs and was successfully repaid. She requests a new loan to cover the costs of weeding and plowing a new plot. I

In the future, Esterlita wants to make improvements to her house and to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to cover the costs of weeding and plowing

loans.name: Felicidad

texts.en:
Felicidad is 62 years old, married and resident of Tabon, Jose Dalman, Zamboanga del Norte, Philippines. Her husband is a fisherman.They have four children who are all married. Starting with capitalization of 5,000 PHP, she opened a sari-sari (general store) and was able to expand it with the help of Paglaum Cooperative. Aside from financial assistance, she was able to generate savings and enjoys the benefit given by the co-op. She became a member in September 2008 and has taken out twelve loans. 

Now she is applying for 14,900 PHP to buy additional stock for her sari-sari store, particularly basic commodities. In the future, she wants to own a mini-mart, and will be fully satisfied if she sees her children finish their studies.

loans.use: to restock her store with goods like soft drinks, canned goods, soap and other basic commodities.

location.town: Sindangan - Tabon, Jose Dalman, Zamboanga del Nort

loans.name: Erilda

texts.en:
Erilda is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fishing business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 18,000 through NWTF to buy a fishing net and other fishing materials for her fishing business.

Erilda has been in this business for 20 years. Erilda earns additional income from food-vending.

Erilda has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy a fishing net and other fishing materials.

loans.name: Florita

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Florita works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from raising pigs. Florita is borrowing PHP 11,000 through NWTF to purchase a fishing net and other fishing materials for her fishing business.

Florita has been sustaining her business activities through her past 19 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase a fishing net and other fishing materials.

loans.name: Leonora

texts.en:
Leonora is 52 years old and married with five children.

She earns a living by pig-fattening in the Philippines. Leonora is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Leonora has been pig-fattening for five years and also earns additional income from a general store.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and now request a new loan to further build her business.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to  save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Munkhkhuyag

texts.en:
Mr. Munkhkhuyag, 43 years old, lives with his wife and three children in Darkhan, the second largest city of Mongolia. He has been working as a security officer at a petroleum supply agency since 2011. 

His eldest daughter studies at university and still didn't pay her tuition fees. So he is requesting a loan of 1,000,000 MNT to pay for his daughter's tuition fees. He thinks the best thing he can do for his daughter is invest in her education which will help her later in life.

loans.use: to pay tuition fees.

loans.name: Lorgen

texts.en:
Lorgen, age 39, is happy tending her little store. She is married with three children. The store is her means of earning a living and supporting her family.  Fortunately, her store is located in a populous neighborhood and so she makes promising daily sales. Lorgen, keeps on running the store well even though there is increased competition from other stores. Lorgen believes that with PMPC's support, as one family they will sustain and beat the competition.  

Lorgen has reached her first year as a member of Paglaum MPC. She has applied for a loan of PHP 3,500 for the store. Expanding her inventory will mean additional income. She has confidence that she can maintain the label of member in good standing. She is a hardworking mother and wishes to sustain the store and from there be able to afford a good education for her children.

loans.use: To purchase additional stock such as noodles, soft drinks and canned goods.

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen is 48 years old and lives in Western Poblacion, Lopez Jaena, Misamis Occidental. She is married with only one child. 

Helen runs a mini-grocery store for a living. She has had this business for 10 years. She requested a loan to purchase additional inventory for her mini-grocery store.

Helen has been a member of PMPC for eight years. In the future, Helen hopes to venture into other businesses.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory for her mini-grocery store.

loans.name: Susie

texts.en:
Susie is 42 years old and married with two children. With one child still in school, Susie works very hard to provide for them.

Susie runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stock to sell like canned goods, soft-drinks, laundry soap, bath soap, shampoo, etc. in her general store.

Susie has been in this business for 10 years and sells a variety of items such as canned goods, soft-drinks, laundry soap, bath soap, shampoo, etc. 

Susie would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional stock to sell like canned goods, soft-drinks, laundry soap, bath soap and shampoo.

loans.name: Nelsy

texts.es:
Nelsy es una joven de 25 años de edad la cual es madre de 2 hijos los cuales son menores de edad y no estudian. Ella es una joven que a muy temprana edad aprendió a trabajar la tierra gracias a sus padres quienes la instruyeron en dicho rubro y posteriormente siguió en práctica con su difunto esposo el cual murió hace muy poco tiempo. La tierra que ella trabaja es propia gracias a una herencia de sus padres los cuales le han apoyado siempre el todo lo necesario posible. Una de las dificultades que ella prioriza y combate cada vez que puede es la alza de precios sobre los insumos que se utilizan en la caficultura como los fertilizantes, abono, foliares entre otros y posteriormente el acarreo del mismo hasta la zona donde ella habita como también la baja de precios en el mercado local e internacional del café ya que la competencia no es un problema. 
Como madre ella sueño con ver a sus hijos convertidos en profesionales con carreras universitarias que ayuden a fortalecer mediante un trabajo o el emprendimiento de una empresa la economía en cada uno de sus hogares. Como meta ella quiere comprar una despulpadora y un pedazo mas de tierra para poder seguir con los sueños de poder ser la mejor productora de café de la zona. Por lo que ella hoy en día solicita un financiamiento con el cual mejorara sus cultivos dando una mejor asistencia aplicando insumos agrícolas como abono, fertilizantes, formula cafetalera, fungicidas que evitaran la contaminación de bichos y enfermedades.
texts.en:
Nelsy is a young mother of 25 who has two young children who don't yet study.  She learned to work the land from a very young age from her parents, who taught her the ropes. She continued this work with her husband, who passed away recently. The land she works is her own, thanks to an inheritance from her parents, who have always supported her in everything she needs as much as possible. 

One of the main problems she fights against whenever she can is the increase in price of the inputs used to grow coffee, such as fertilizers, compost, foliar products and others, and later, transport to the area where she lives, and the fall in prices in the local and international coffee market, because competition is not a problem.

As a mother, she dreams of seeing her children become professionals with university degrees, which  help them, through a job or a business, have a strong family income. Her aim is to buy a pulper and another plot of land, so that she can foster her dream of being the biggest coffee producer in the area. 

This is why she is requesting a loan with which to improve her crops, nourishing them with agricultural inputs such as compost, fertilizer, coffee grower's formula, and to fungicides to protect against pests and plagues.

loans.use: to buy agricultural inputs for her coffee plants.

loans.name: Rancho Loma Bonita Group

texts.es: El grupo “Rancho Loma Bonita” está ubicado en una comunidad muy bonita y tranquila para llegar a ella solo es en transporte público, enseguida esta el negocio de los integrantes del grupo aunque para llegar a su casa esta mucho más lejos ellos también tiene un pequeño ranchito donde tienen varios animales, el nombre del grupo lo eligieron precisamente porque les gusta mucho el lugar donde viven porque viven en un ranchito y el lugar donde está ubicado es en una lomita. Doña Guadalupe o Lupita, como mejor la conocen, es integrante del grupo ella tiene 55 años de edad está casada con el señor Adán desde hace 30 años juntos han formado una familia con dos hijos pero ya son independientes. Ella tiene un pequeño molino de nixtamal y otro para moler sacate para sus animales, sus molinos tiene más de 20 años “Inicié con los molinos porque desde que me casé mi esposo tenía muchos animales y yo lo ayudaba mucho y fue como aprendí a manejar estos molinos”  Esta vez está solicitando el crédito para hacer algunas reparaciones para sus molinos. Doña Lupita todos los días da servicio en su molino de nixtamal sus clientas pueden encontrar el servicio para poder moler su maíz para la elaboración de sus tortillas. Doña Lupita comento “Quiero echarle muchas ganas para salir adelante para poder hacer otro local chico para otro negocio”. La ventaja de ellos es que están en un buen lugar  para tener más clientes, los integrantes del grupo son Don Alfredo quien invertirá en su carnicería, Don Adán en la venta de abarrotes y Don Isidro en la compra de bovinos.
texts.en:
The "Rancho Loma Bonita" group is based in a beautiful, calm village which can only be reached by public transport. Their business place is right in the village, but their houses are much farther away. They also have a small ranch where they have many animals. They chose this group name because they like the place where they live. They live on a ranch on a small hill ("loma"). 

Guadalupe, or Lupita, as she is better known, is a member of this group. She is 55 years old and has been married to Adán for 30 years. They have two children who are now independent. She has a small corn mill and another mill which she uses to make feed for her animals. Her mills are more than 20 years old. "I started up with the mills because when I got married, my husband had many animals and I helped him a lot. That is how I learned to work with these mills." 

She is applying for this loan to make repairs to her mills. Lupita offers the service of her corn mill every day. Her clients come to her to grind their corn to make tortillas. Lupita says, "I want to work very hard so that I can manage to open another small place for another business." 

The group members' advantage is that they are in a good location to have many clients. The other members of the group are Alfredo, who will invest in his butcher's shop, Adán, who will invest in his vegetable sales, and Isidro, who will buy cattle.

loans.use: to repair his mills.

location.town: Guarda de la Laguinita, San Jose del Rincon

loans.name: Yah Nissi Group

texts.es: El grupo “Yah Nissi” se encuentra en una comunidad muy cerca del municipio, para llegar a ella se necesita transporte público es una comunidad en la cual prevalece gente comerciante o con algún negocio en su familia, El grupo está conformado por cinco mujeres muy trabajadoras y emprendedoras ellas necesitan de este crédito para invertir en sus negocios. Doña Felipa invertirá en hule y controles para vender, Elizabeth invertirá en jarcieria, Magdalena invertirá en bonetería, Maribel invertirá en vasos para licuadora, ellas se conocen desde hace ya muchos años viven en la misma comunidad, el nombre “Yah Nissi" significa “Jeova es mi Bandera” Areli quien es la representante del grupo es muy alegre tiene 19 años de edad termino la preparatoria es soltera y vive con sus padres. Areli se dedica a la venta de jarcieria con su hermano desde hace un año en varios lugares de la republica Mexicana “Me gusta vender este tipo de artículos porque aunque son cosas muy pequeñas se vende muy bien y mis ganancias son buenas” También porque tiene mucho contacto con muchas personas y conoce varios lugares. Cuenta que su dificultad mas grande es cuando los inspectores no dejan vender en cualquier lugar siempre están viendo la manera de obtener dinero para el beneficio de ellos mismos, Areli necesita de este crédito porque comprara más productos de jarcieria como aretes, bolitas, corta uñas, pulseras, vasos de licuadora, trapos etc. porque con la inversión espera que sus ganancias sean mayor porque aunque no tenga grandes gastos ahorra mucho para poder seguir estudiando una carrera profesional. “No pude seguir estudiando porque no aprobé el examen de admisión para ingresar a la universidad” por eso está ahorrando mucho para ingresar a una universidad privada pero tampoco quiere dejar de trabajar  en su negocio.
texts.en:
The "Yah Nissi" group is located in a community very close to the city which can be accessed by public transport. In this community, there are many merchants and people who have a family business. 

This group is made up of five hardworking, enterprising women who need this loan to invest in their businesses. Felipa will invest in rubber and remotes to sell, Elizabeth will invest in garden tools, Magdalena will invest in hoisery, Maribel will invest in glass jugs for blenders. They have known each other for a long time and live in the same village. The name "Yah Nissi" means "Jehovah is my banner." 

Areli, the group representative, is a very happy person. She is 19 years old and finished secondary school. She is single and lives with her parents. She has had a business selling home goods and personal products with her brother for one year in various locations in Mexico. She says, "I like selling this type of items because although they are very small things, they sell well and I earn a good income." She also likes having contact with many people and getting to know other places. She says that her greatest obstacle is when inspectors do not allow her to sell her products in some places. 

She and her brother are constantly searching for ways to earn money. Areli needs this loan to buy more products, such as earrings, beads, nail clippers, bracelets, blender jugs, towels, etc. With this investment, she hopes that her earnings will be higher. Even though she does not have many expenses, she is saving up to study a professional degree. "I couldn't continue studying because I didn't pass the exam to enter university," she said. Therefore, she is saving a lot to go to a private university. However, she does not want to stop working in her business.

loans.use: to buy personal products and home goods such as towels, spoons, mats, clothespins, etc.

location.town: San Agustin Mextepec, San Felipe del progreso

loans.name: Lida

texts.en:
Lida is 64 years old and married with three children. Lida works very hard to provide for them.

Lida runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell.

Lida has been in this business for 18 years and sells a variety of items such as biscuits, canned good, rice, noodles and school supplies. 

In the future Lida would like to build and expand her business to support the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to open a tattoo and piercing shop.

loans.name: Rosa Lastenia

texts.es:
Rosa es una joven de 22 años de edad, agricultora y ama de casa, madre de un hijo el cual no tiene edad para ir a la primaria. Tiene seis años de educación primaria los cuales pudo cursar gracias al apoyo financiero y moral de sus padres mismos que le enseñaron a trabajar la tierra a temprana edad siendo la actividad del cultivo de café una tradición en su familia. En compañía de sus conyugue ejerce dicha actividad desde hace cuatro años siendo ellos apoyo uno del otro para poder fortalecer su hogar, la economía del mismo y el bienestar y futuro de su hijo. El terreno es una herencia de parte de sus padres el cual está ubicado a 500 metros, muy cerca de su casa de habitación al cual se trasladan caminando diariamente para dar asistencia y mantenimiento. Una de las mayores prioridades que ella y su compañero de hogar tienen es mantener sus cultivos limpios de plagas como la roya y la broca que destruyen unas plantaciones completas llevando a pérdidas el tiempo dedicado y en dinero invertido.
Su sueño es poder algún día tener una techo digno y propio, seguir fortaleciendo sus tierras mediante la compra y la plantación de café en la misma. Su deseo y sueño es que cuando su hijo crezca, estudie y tenga un mejor futuro, una mejor preparación de la que ella y su compañero de hogar tienen. Por lo que ella hoy en día solicita financiamiento para poder comprar insumos agrícolas para poder asistir sus cultivos de café dando la mayor asistencia posible para poder obtener un excelente grano.
texts.en:
Rosa is a young 22 year old farmer and housewife. She is the mother of one child who is not yet old enough to go to school. She has six years of primary school thanks to her parents' moral and financial support. It was her parents who taught her to work on the land at a young age given that growing coffee is a family tradition. With her partner she has been carrying out this activity for four years, each of them supporting the other in order to strengthen their home, economic situation and the well-being and future of their child. 

The land was inherited to her by her parents which is located 500 meters from their home, which is very close from them to travel on foot each day to provide up-keep and maintenance. One of her and her spouse's greatest priorities is to keep their crops free of pests like the leaf rust and borers that destroy her entire harvest, resulting in a loss of time and money invested. 

Her dreams are to be able to put up a dignified roof someday, and to continue strengthening her land through the purchase and planting of coffee. She hopes that as her son gets older, he studies, has a brighter future, and greater preparation than that which her and her spouse have had. For this reason she is requesting this financing to be able to buy the agricultural supplies to continue to attend to her crops and give the best maintenance possible in order to have an excellent harvest.

loans.use: to purchase agricultural supplies so that she can attend to her coffee crops.

loans.name: Lerny

texts.en:
Lerny is married, with two children. She runs a general store to earn a living. She has been doing this business for more than three years. 

Recently, she joined Gata Daku Multi-Purpose Cooperative (GDMPC) and borrowed a loan to buy additional grocery goods, like canned goods, noodles, and sugar. She always finds ways to augment their living. 

In the future, Lerny hopes to have a bigger store to work with, to have a stable income for the family.

loans.use: to buy additional grocery goods, like canned goods, noodles, and sugar.

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en:
Arlene is 42 years old and lives in Rizal, Lopez Jaena, Misamis Occidental. She is married and has 5 children. 

Arlene a mini grocery store that she operates to earn a living. She has had this business for 7 years. She has requested a loan  to purchase additional inventory for her mini grocery store.

Arlene has been a member of PMPC for 8 years. In the future, Arlene hopes to be able to save enough for her children's education.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory for her mini grocery store.

loans.name: Munkhtsetseg

texts.en:
Mrs. Munkhtsetseg, 26 years old, lives with her two brothers, mother and daughter in a Mongolian traditional ger (portable felt dwelling) on fenced land in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. She has been working as an interior decorator for one and half years. Her mother stays at home, looking after Mrs. Munkhtsetseg's daughter. Her younger brother studies at university towards an engineering degree. 

Mrs. Munkhtsetseg is requesting a loan of 2,000,000 MNT to pay her brother's tuition fees. After graduation, her brother can secure a job and contribute to the family's income. Investing in education is the best thing she can do for her brother.

loans.use: to pay for tuition fees.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
While taking care of her grand children, Maria manages her beauty salon business. She offers services for hair styling and make-up. To make her income more reliable, Maria also manages a catering service and offering 'special occasion' gowns for rent. 

Maria wants to borrow PHP 50,000 to buy materials for her beauty salon and her catering services business. She plans to buy hair treatments, fabric for chairs and table cloths.

loans.use: to buy materials for her beauty salon and catering services.

loans.name: Luz

texts.en:
Luz is 56 years old and lives in Usocan, Plaridel, Misamis Occidental. She is married and has 3 children. 

Luz works in the fish industry and catches fish for a living. She has been doing this for 5 years. She has requested a loan to purchase fishing nets and other fishing materials.. 

Luz has been a member of PMPC for 10 years. In the future, Luz hopes to have more savings for her daughter's education.

loans.use: to purchase fishing nets and other fishing materials.

loans.name: Ana

texts.en:
Ana is still single and has no children. She is 59 years old and lives in Bato, Plaridel, Misamis Occidental Philippines.

Ana is a farmer and grows corn on a farm to earn a living. She has been doing this for 5 years. She has requested a loan to purchase farm inputs, like fertilizers, and to pay for laborers.

Ana has been a member of PMPC for 8 years. In the future, Ana hopes to have enough savings for her future.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and to pay for farm laborers.

loans.name: Barrio El Riito Group

texts.es: El grupo "Barrio el Riito" está integrado por siete mujeres todas son mujeres mazahuas que pertenecen a la misma comunidad la cual es muy bonita e interesante porque tiene varias fiestas en todo el año, sobretodo porque aun conservan sus culturas como su lengua materna y su vestimenta muy colorida. El nombre del grupo lo eligieron ellas mismas porque viven muy cerca de un río pequeño. Las personas de esa comunidad utilizan esta agua para usos múltiples. Elodia es una mujer muy joven pero sobretodo muy alegre tiene 24 años sin embrago a su corta edad tiene un gran espíritu emprendedor, vive en unión libre desde hace seis años con Jaime quien trabaja en la construcción de casas, juntos han formado una familia con dos niños su niño más grande tiene cinco años aun no asiste a la escuela y su bebe. Elodia se dedica a la cría y engorda de pollos y guajolotes desde hace ya cinco años cuando vivía con su mamá aprendió como criarlos desde pequeños hasta cuando ya están grandes cuando decidió formar su propia familia también decidió ayudar de alguna manera a su esposo con los gastos del hogar, Elodia no puede salir a trabajar porque sus niños están pequeños y no tiene quien le ayude a cuidarlos Elodia está muy agradecida con KIVA y Visión Fund por el crédito otorgado porque así podrá comprar sus pollitos y guajolotes pequeños  los cuida en casa durante ocho meses para venderlos o para utilizarlos para alimento para su propia familia así ya no gasta en la comida de su familia, La única dificultad de Eloisa es cuando sus animales enferman y mueran Élla cree que es porque muchas veces hace mucho frio y como no tiene un corral estable para sus animalitos por esa misma razón llegan a morir, esta situación no le causa desanimo en dejarla para Eloisa es muy normal que pase, la única meta de Eloisa es poder llegar tener mas pollos y guajolotes son animales muy bien comprados en tiempos de fiestas en las comunidades, Eloisa comento “Tengo casa propia afortunadamente pero me gustaría mejorarla para poder llegar a tener todos los servicios y vivir mejor” También uno de los sueños de Eloisa es poder solventar todos los gastos de educación de sus hijos y puedan estudiar una carrera profesional. Los integrantes del grupo están muy contentos y agradecidos con Vision Fund y KIVA porque podrán invertir en sus negocios: Doña Tomasa  podrá comprar becerros, mientras que Doña Luisa, Rosaura, Pilar, Tomasa y Antonia están solicitando el crédito para comprar más borregos y finalmente Doña Herlinda podrá comprar sus pollos,
texts.en:
The group, "Barrio el Riito" is made up of eight women, all of whom are Mazahuas. They belong to the same community, which is very beautiful and interesting because it has various festivals all year, and above all because they preserve their culture like their native language and very colorful dress. They chose the name of the group themselves because of the small river that they live close to. The people in the community use its water for many things. 

Elodia is a 24-year-old young woman who is very happy and despite her young age has a great, enterprising spirit.  She has been in a free union with her husband Jaime (who works in construction) for 6 years.  Together, they have a family with 2 children.  Their youngest child is their 5-year-old who hasn't started school yet.  They also have an infant.

Elodia has worked raising chickens and turkeys for 5 years.  She learned how to raise them from chicks until they become adults thanks to her mother.  When she decided to start her own family, she decided to find some way to help her husband with the household expenses and started raising chickens on her own.  She isn't able to leave the house to work because her children are young and there is no one else to take care of them.

Elodia is very grateful to Kiva and Vision Fund for the loan because it will allow her to buy her small turkeys and chickens.  She will take care of them in her house for 8 months and then either sell them or use them to feed her family to save on food expenses.  The only problem that Eloida has is when her animals get sick and die.  She thinks that it is often because it is very cold and she doesn't have a coop for them.  This challenge doesn't discourage her, however, because these things happen.

Elodia's only goal is to be able to have more chickens and turkeys, since they sell very well during holidays in her community.  Elodia mentioned that "I am fortunate to have my own house but I would like to improve it so as to have access to all basic utilities and live better."  In addition, one of Elodia's dreams is to pay for the education of her children and allow them to study to have professional jobs.

The members of the group and very happy and grateful to Vision Fund and Kiva because they will be able to invest in their businesses.  Tomasa will be able to buy bull calves while Luisa, Rosaura, Pilar, Tomasa, and Antonia are asking for loans to buy sheep.  Finally, Herlinda will be able to stock her grocery store.

loans.use: buy chickens and turkeys.

location.town: San Antonio La Cienega, San Felipe del Progreso

loans.name: Junalyn

texts.en:
As a married parent of one child, Junalyn works hard to support her family.

Junalyn has a general store business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from raising pigs.  She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her general store business. Junalyn is borrowing 16,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) through NWTF to purchase more items to sell in her general store.

Junalyn has been sustaining her business activities through her past nine loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more items to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Bayarmagnai

texts.en:
Mrs. Bayarmagnai, 43 years old, lives with her son in an old Mongolian traditional ger (portable felt dwelling) on a plot of land. Seven months ago, she began working as a saleswoman at a supermarket and before this job, she had been selling foodstuffs by renting a grocery store for a while. Her son is now seventeen years old and he is practicing welding in a building company. 

She is requesting a loan of 4,000,000 MNT (Mongolian Tugrik) to buy insulation materials such as fiberglass, felt and foam, as well as to install a low pressure heater. 

After renovation, she and her son will live in a comfortable and warm place where less coal is burned for heating, so then fewer pollutants are released into the air.

loans.use: to renovate her Mongolian ger (portable felt dwelling).

loans.name: Hearty

texts.en:
Hearty is married with four children. Hearty is 52 years old and lives in Balanlinao, Plaridel, Misamis Occidental Philippines.

Hearty is a farmer and grows  rice farm  to earn a living. She has been doing this for 10  years. She has requested a loan to purchase farm inputs like fertilizers and pesticides.

Hearty has been a member of PMPC for a year. In the future, Hearty hopes to have enough savings for her family's future.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and pesticides.

loans.name: Anita

texts.en:
Anita is 61 years old and lives in Magsaysay, Panaon,  Misamis Occidental. She is married with three children. 

Anita has a store and sells groceries and other consumable products and earns approximately PHP 2,000 each month doing this type of work. She has requested a loan to be used in purchasing additional groceries and other consumable products for retail. 

Anita has been a member of PMPC since just this year. In the future, Anita hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase additional groceries and other consumable products.

loans.name: Lyn

texts.en:
Lyn is married with two children. Lyn is 51 years old and lives in Balanlinao, Plaridel, Misamis Occidental Philippines.

Lyn is a farmer and grows rice on her farm to earn a living. She has been doing this for 19  years. She has requested a loan to pay for labor and to purchase fertilizers and pesticides.

Lyn has been a member of PMPC for a year. In the future, Lyn hopes to have enough savings for her family's future.

loans.use: to pay for labor and to purchase fertilizers and pesticides.

loans.name: Lucila

texts.en:
Lucila is 48 years old and married with five children.

Lucila works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 26,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Lucila has borrowed and repaid 19 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for twenty-five years and also earns an income from food vending.

Lucila aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia is 67 years old and a widowed mother with seven children.

Lydia is in the agricultural business, farming rice in the Philippines. Lydia requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Lydia has been farming rice for eleven years now, and has borrowed 21 times in the past from NWTF and more recently, from Kiva to sustain it.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough to buy more farm land.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Ma. Theresa

texts.en:
Ma. Theresa is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a hardware business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 13,000 through NWTF in order to purchase more stocks of hardware for her store.

Ma. Theresa has been in this business for 10 years. She earns more income from farming rice.

Ma. Theresa has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of hardware for her store.

loans.name: Mary Rio

texts.en:
Mary Rio is 33 years old and married with two children.

Mary Rio works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Mary Rio has borrowed and repaid 19 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 13 years and also earns an income from selling jewelry.

Mary Rio aspires to save money so she can continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Nicholas

texts.en:
Nicholas, age 58, is a rice farmer. He has been earning a living through farming rice for the past 33 years. He and his wife have three children and live in Sta. Cruz, Plaridel, Misamis Occidental.

Nicholas has been a member of PMPC for four years. He is requesting a loan in order to pay for labor and to purchase farm inputs like fertilizers and pesticides.

In the future, Nicholas hopes to acquire land on which to farm coconuts.

loans.use: to pay for labor and to purchase fertilizers and pesticides.

loans.name: Lodilen

texts.en:
Lodilen is 36 years old and lives in Mangidkid, Plaridel, Misamis Occidental. She is married with two children. 

Lodilen has a pig raising business and earns approximately PHP 2,000 each month doing this type of work. She has requested a loan to purchase feed.

Lodilen has been a member of PMPC for five years. In the future, she hopes to have more savings for her children's education.

loans.use: to purchase feed

loans.name: Natividad

texts.en:
Natividad, age 63, is a seafood vendor. She has been selling seafood to earn a living for the past 40 years. She earns PhP 3,000 per month. She and her husband have 10 children and live in Panalsalan, Plaridel, Misamis Occidental.
  
Natividad has been a member of PMPC for seven years. He is requesting a loan in the amount of PhP 5,000 in order to purchase seafood to offer for sale.
 
In the future, Natividad hopes to acquire a pump boat to use for fishing.

loans.use: to purchase seafood to offer for sale

loans.name: Rodivico

texts.en:
Rodivico is married with two children. He is 69 years old and lives in Villa Consuelo, Ozamiz City.

Rodivico has a sari-sari store and he has had this business for 20 years. Each month, he earns PHP 15,000 doing this type of work. He has requested a loan for PHP 40,000 to to purchase additional inventory like canned goods, soft drinks, and basic commodities.

Rodivico has been a member of PMPC for eight years. In the future, he hopes to have another branch of sari-sari.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory like canned goods, soft drinks, and basic commodities

loans.name: Samnang

texts.en:
Samnang is 46 years old and married with two children, one of whom plans to attend a university and the other is at high school level. Samnang and her husband raise their children in a rural village in Romeas Haek district, Prey Veng province. They own and manage three hectares of farmland for growing rice to sell into the markets of the province. Aside from farming tasks, Samnang also raises two pigs at the backyard of her house to gain additional income. This year Samnang is experiencing financial difficulties in sending her oldest child to join a university in Phnom Penh. Her son, Than, aged 18, is planning to enter the faculty of science at Royal University of Phnom Penh, the oldest and largest University in Cambodia. His dream is to be a mathematics lecturer at the university, but his first step is to be a high school teacher and then further his education to achieve his goal.

Samnanag, with the loan amount requested, will pay for her son’s tuition. Than, pictured here, will be furthering his education with the funds from this loan. His mother, who is not included in the picture, is applying for the loan from Kiva, and will be responsible for principal repayments. They await your kindness and hope for your charity.

loans.use: to pay for her son’s tuition.

loans.name: Gerry

texts.en:
Gerry, a 46-year-old widowed mother of one, lives in Camanga, Tukuran where she has operated a store for nine years. A member of PMPC for two years, she has requested a loan to restock her store with additional inventories such as basic commodities.

In the future, Gerry hopes to have her own grocery store.

loans.use: to restock her store with additional inventories like basic commodities

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a horse to carry merchandise.

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia, age 60 and widowed, is a rice farmer. She has been earning a living through rice farming for almost 20 years and earns a net income ranging between PhP 25,000 and 35,000 every cropping. Her profits are spent on her family's expenditures and are used to pay for farm labor. Lydia has two children.
 
Currently, due to insufficient funds, Lydia has decided to request a loan amounting to PhP 39,000. She will use her loan funds to purchase fertilizers, seedlings, and insecticides for her rice farm. 

She is hopeful that her requested loan will be granted so that she can earn a greater profit to better support her family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers, seedlings, and insecticides for her rice farm.

loans.name: Dilbar

texts.ru: Дилбар трудолюбивая женщина. Ей 35 лет. Она замужем и на воспитании имеет 2 детей. Ее муж водитель. Они воспитывают одного сына, которого зовут Фирдавс и одну дочь, которую зовут Мадина. Дилбар в течение многих лет не работала и занималась воспитанием детей. Сегодня ее дети выросли,  и она имеет возможность начать свой бизнес. Она долго мечтала организовать свой бизнес, но не имела поддержки. Она участвовала в курсе «Добейся Успеха» организованного Ассоциация деловых Женщин. Она написала свой бизнес план. Она хочет организовать свой бизнес купле продажей скота. Она хочет заниматься разведением мелко-рогатого скота. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 4000 сомони для покупки мелко-рогатого скота. Ее дети будут помогать ей по откармливанию скота. Она ждет вашу доброту и надеется на ваше милосердие.
texts.en:
Dilbar is a hardworking woman. She is 35 years old. She is married and raising two children. Her husband is a driver. They are raising one son, who is called Firdavs, and one daughter, who is called Madina. 

For many years, Dilbar did not work and was engaged in raising the children. Now the children are older and she has an opportunity to start her own business. For long she has dreamed of setting up a business, but did not have support. She participated in the training "To get ahead", organized by the Association of Business Women. She wrote her own business plan. 

Dilbar would like to set up a business of animal sales. She would like to breed sheep and goats. She requests a loan in the amount of 4,000 somoni for the purchase of sheep and goats. Her children will help her with fattening the livestock. She awaits your kindness and hopes for your charity.

loans.use: To purchase livestock for setting up a new business

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en: Marilyn is 44 years old. She is married and has four children. She lives in Landing, Baliangao, Misamis Occidental, and has engaged in a small restaurant business with video k. She has been in this business for more than six years and earned a monthly income of PHP 6,000. Marilyn requested a new loan to purchase a new television for her video k since the previous one is no longer functioning. Marilyn is a Cumi member of Paglaum MPC since 2004 and a member of good standing. She dreams of having a small sari-sari store soon.

loans.use: to purchase a new television for video karaoke for her small video k business

loans.name: Ruth

texts.es:
Doña Ruth es una tiene una edad de 36 años, en un estado civil en unión libre madre de tres hijos los cuales están en diferentes grados de educación en la primaria en una escuela de la comunidad. Ella cuenta con un grado de educación primario incompleto por lo que pudo cursar hasta el cuarto grado y a pesar de eso ella agradece el esfuerzo que sus padres hicieron ya que ellos son de escasos recursos. Con ella también viven sus suegros mismos que ayudan y contribuyen con el cuidado de sus nietos cuando ella y su pareja se desplazan hasta sus cultivos de café para dar el mantenimiento y asistencia necesaria posible. El terreno que ella y su pareja cultivan es propio gracias al esfuerzo puesto para poder comprarle a los papas de su pareja un pedazo de tierra con el cual pueden generar ingresos para el sustento de su familia el cual está ubicado cerca de su casa de habitación al cual se trasladan caminando a una distancia de 1.5 kilómetros.  
Actualmente ella ha solicitado un financiamiento a la cooperativa COMIXMUL pata la compra de abono, formula cafetalera, fertilizantes, foliares entre otros para dar asistencia y protección a sus cultivos de café con los cuales planea sacar una buena cosecha y un grano atractivo para sus clientes.
Sus planes son mejorar y abonar la tierra que juntos cultivan para que sus cultivos de café mantengan el follaje y el grano sano ya que de esta forma ellos podrán contar con una cosecha segura. Su sueño es como el de toda madre apoyar a sus hijos en sus estudios y lograr enviarlos a la universidad para que ellos puedan graduarse de una carrera universitaria y que no pasen por la misma situación que ellos en su juventud.
texts.en:
Ruth is 36 years old and has a common-law spouse. She is the mother of three children in different grades at a primary school in the community. Ruth did not complete primary school; she was able to go to school until the fourth grade. She is nevertheless grateful for the effort her parents made as they are people of few resources. 

Her parents-in-law are also living with her, and they help out and contribute by watching their grandchildren while she and her partner are out tending to the coffee plants to give them the necessary care as much as possible. She and her partner own the field they cultivate, thanks to the effort they made to be able to buy a piece of land from her partner's parents, with which they are able to generate an income to sustain the family. The land is located near the house they live in, and they get there by walking a distance of 1.5 kilometers. 

She has currently requested a loan through the COMIXMUL cooperative to buy compost, coffee formula fertilizer, fertilizers, liquid fertilizer, and other items to help and protect her coffee crop. She plans to use these items to reap a good harvest and an attractive bean for her clients. Her plans are to improve the land they cultivate together so that her coffee crop will maintain its foliage and healthy beans, which will allow them to make sure of the harvest. Her dream is like that of any mother, to support her children in their studies and to be able to send them to university so that they can get their degree, and that they don't live the same situation as she and her partner did in their own youth.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies for the protection and maintenance of her coffee plants

loans.name: Samir Gregorio

texts.es: Samir es una víctima más del desplazamiento forzado, salió de su pueblo natal hacia la ciudad debido a la grave situación de violencia que se presentaba en la zona, junto con su esposa y sus hijos se trasladó para la ciudad en busca de una nueva oportunidad para comenzar desde cero, pues tuvo que dejar atrás su vivienda y su negocio. Ya radicado en la ciudad le era difícil emplearse, por lo que decidió acudir a diferentes agiotistas o “paga diarios” para comprar frutas y verduras que luego vendería de manera ambulante; fue así como inició su propio negocio y, hoy en día, para complementar los ingresos también se dedica a trabajar como obrero temporal en obras de construcción, alternando ambas actividades logra generar recursos económicos para solventar las necesidades de su hogar. Su empuje, perseverancia y optimismo le han permitido lograr sus objetivos y ahora desea fortalecer su negocio con la ayuda del crédito que solicita; con el dinero realizará adecuaciones en una nueva carretilla que adquirió, comprar una sombrilla grande, comprar surtido al por mayor (frutas y verduras en cosecha) y, pagar el saldo de un crédito que tiene vigente. Esto le permitirá aumentar su patrimonio y la capacidad para vender más cantidad de productos, pues la carreta nueva es para cederla a uno de sus hijos para que éste la trabaje y genere ingresos con los que pueda aportar a la economía del hogar, además estará a paz y salvo con el crédito que le cobra unos intereses muy costosos, afectando sus finanzas. De esta forma, Samir desea seguir luchando y así poder llegar a cumplir el sueño de tener su casa propia, en la que pueda adaptar un local para tener su negocio, logrando que sea rentable y que le garantice a su familia una estabilidad económica favorable para disfrutar de una mejor calidad de vida en compañía de sus seres amados.
texts.en: Samir was a victim of forced displacement.  He left his town of birth and headed for the city because of violence.  With his wife and children, he came to the city in search of new opportunities and to start from scratch. Samir left behind his home and business.  Here in the city it was difficult to find work and so Samir approached short-term loan sharks in order to buy fruits and vegetables, which he would then sell as a street vendor.  This is how he started his own business and now he also works as a temporary labourer in the construction industry, in order to supplement his income.  He goes between both jobs and is able to earn enough money to cover household costs.  Samir's drive, perseverance and optimism have allowed him to achieve his goals and he now wants to strengthen his business with the help of this loan:  with it, he will do up his new cart, buy a big parasol, buy stock (in-season fruits and vegetables) in bulk, and pay off a loan.  This will allow Samir to increase his assets and will improve his ability to sell a higher quantity of products.  The new cart is to give to one of his children, who will use it to work and bring in an income to support the household economy.  This loan will allow Samir to pay off his other loan, which has very high interest rates and is affecting his financial situation.  Samir wants to keep fighting and achieve his dream of having his own house.  With a house, he can have his own premises for his business, making it profitable and guaranteeing a good financial situation for his family.  Samir will then be able to enjoy a higher quality of life alongside his loved ones.

loans.use: to do up his new cart, to buy a big parasol, to buy stock (in-season fruits and vegetables) in bulk, and to pay off a loan.

loans.name: Telma Esperanza

texts.es:
Telma es una mujer joven de 28 años de edad emprendedora, luchadora con muchas ganas de salir adelante que junto a su esposo se dedican a la agricultura con el cual procreo 3 hijos los cuales viven en casa y estudian en la escuela de la comunidad. Telma aprendió este oficio desde que era muy pequeña siendo sus padres quienes le enseñaran a trabajar la tierra ya que ellos son agricultores por generaciones y hoy en día sigue ejerciendo la labor en compañía de sus esposo. Los cultivos que trabaja en compañía de su esposo son propios los cuales están ubicados en una comunidad cercana la cual está a medio kilómetro de camino trasladándose diariamente para dar asistencia. Telma tiene un grado de educación secundaria cursado hasta el 11 grado pero por dificultades económicas por sus padres no pudo continuar estudiando.
Sus sueños y planes a futuro como madre es ver a sus hijos en mejores condiciones de vida, con mejores oportunidades de empleo y con una tierra donde vivir y trabajar. Para su negocio poder sembrar una mayor cantidad y variedad de producto para de esa manera fortalecer sus tierras y fortalecer la economía en su hogar. Por los que hoy en día ha solicitado un financiamiento con el cual ella pueda inyectar capital fresco a sus cultivos protegiéndolos con los diferentes insumos que comprara como abono, fertilizantes, fungicidas entre otros que harán de la temporada una buena cosecha.
texts.en:
Telma is 28 years old and an enterprising and feisty young woman.  She has a great desire to get ahead.  Telma is married and has three children, all of whom live at home and are studying at the local school.  Telma and her husband work in agriculture.  Telma learned this trade from a very young age, from her parents who taught her to work the land.  Telma's family has been farming for generations and Telma is continuing this work with her husband.  Telma and her husband have their own crops in a nearby community - it is one kilometre away and the couple goes there every day to look after the crops.  Telma completed up to 11th grade at high school, but was not able to complete her education due to financial difficulties.

Telma's dreams and plans for the future, as a mother, are to see her children enjoy better living conditions, have better job opportunities, and to have a plot of land where they can live and work.  In terms of her work, Telma wants to be able to sow more crops, and a greater variety of products, so as to strengthen her land and improve her household's financial situation.  In order to do all of this, Telma is applying for a loan in order to inject fresh capital into her crops, and to protect them with different supplies such as manure, fertiliser, fungicides and more.  This will give her a good harvest.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies to help her coffee crops.

loans.name: Andres Jr

texts.en:
Andres, age 72, runs an upholstery shop to earn a living. He has operated his business for 53 years and earns approximately PhP 20,000 per month. He and his wife have five children and live in in Maningcol, Ozamiz City.
 
Andres has been a member of PMPC for four years. He is requesting a loan in order to purchase materials for his shop.

In the future, Andres hopes to sustain his financial needs and to support his family.

loans.use: to purchase materials for his shop.

loans.name: Sabletkan

texts.ru: Саблеткан 58 лет, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают 2 детей. У Саблеткан - высшее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи Саблеткан занимается животноводством, стартовав 10 лет назад, с покупки скота на 5,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Саблеткан, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 2 дойные коровы, 1 нетель, 10 овец, 10 коз. Ежемесячный доход составляет 10,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Саблеткан обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на покупку телят для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита Саблеткан планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, и планирует накопить средства на покупку нового дома.
texts.en:
Sabletkan is 58 years old, married and raising two children together with her husband. Sabletkan has higher education. As a main source of income for her family, Sabletkan works with livestock breeding, after having started 10 years ago with the purchase of livestock for 5,000 som (KGS). Thanks to Sabletkan's persistent work, her farm currently has two dairy cows, one heifer, 10 sheep and 10 goats. The monthly income is 10,000 som (KGS). 

With an aim to further develop her business, Sabletkan turned to the microfinance bank "Bai Tushum & Partners" for a loan in the amount of 100,000 som (KGS) for the purchase of calves to increase the number of livestock. Sabletkan plans to invest the income from the loan in further increasing the number of household animals. She also plans to save money to purchase a new home.

loans.use: to buy calves

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en: Veronica is 54 years old, married, and has three children. She owns and operates a business planting and harvesting sugarcane "tubo" to sell. In 2008, Veronica joined GDMPC and her previous loan that was used for farm inputs was successfully repaid. Veronica is requesting a new loan to cover the costs of plowing and fertilization of the farm. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to cover the costs of plowing and fertilization of the farm

loans.name: Fatmata

texts.en:
Fatmata is 35 years old and married with four children. She runs a palm oil business in Tombo, western rural area, in Sierra Leone. She started this business to get her daily living. 

She's been in this business since just after she got married and sells palm oil within her community. She says that at present, her business is doing well because out of the profit, she was able to take care of her family.

Fatmata requested this loan through BRAC Sierra Leone to buy more palm oil for resale. She says that the extra income from this loan will help her increase her business and be able to have a permanent business location. 

In the future, she would like to expand her business to a higher level. She is grateful for your support.

loans.use: to buy more palm oil for resale.

loans.name: Shuhrat

texts.ru:
Шухрат молодой мужчина в возрасте 30 лет, женат имеет 2 детей. В течение последних пяти лет, Шухрат упорно трудился, чтобы управлять своей лавкой, где продает головной убор.

Стремясь к расширению своего бизнеса, Шухрат попросил кредит в Арванде.Настоящий кредит будет использовать, для покупки  автомобиля чтобы ему было легче перевозить свой товар. До этого времени он отвозил товар на маршрутном такси и ему было очень тяжело. Теперь Шухрат надеется,что после получения кредита и покупки авто он намного облегчить свои условия.
 Также Шухрат   в будущем планирует открыть собственный магазин и начать продавать свой товар оптом.
Шухрат является клиентом Арванд уже много лет и никогда не имел просрочки.  Он очень ответственный и пунктуальный клиент. Шухрат   всячески благодарен Арванд и КИВА за финансовую поддержку.
texts.en:
