Shuhrat is a young man of the age of 30. He is married and has two children. For the last five years, Shuhrat has worked hard in order to manage his store where he sells head wear. Striving to expand his business, Shuhrat applied for a loan from Arvand. 

Shuhrat will use the current to purchase a car, so that it will be easier for him to transport his goods. Up until now he has transported goods by shuttle bus and it has been very hard for him. Shuhrat hopes that receiving a loan and purchasing a car will ease his work. Also, Shuhrat plans to open his own store in the future, and start selling his goods wholesale. 

Shuhrat has been a client of Arvand for many years already and never had a delay in paying back. He is a very responsible and punctual client. Shuhrat thanks Arvand and Kiva in every way for the financial support.

loans.use: to purchase a car to ease the transport of goods

loans.name: Tita

texts.en: Tita has been running a general store for five years in their community to earn a living. She is married with six children. Recently, she had joined GDMPC and borrowed a loan to to buy additional canned goods, soap bars, shampoo, and beverages. Tita wants to gain more revenue and use it to renovate her store for a comfortable venture. In the future, she wants to have an improved general living situation.

loans.use: to to buy additional canned goods, soap bars, shampoo, and beverages

loans.name: Arthur

texts.en: Arthur is 38 years old and married with one child. He owns and operates a motorcycle transport in the local community to earn a living. Aside from this, he also was engaged in retailing goods for more than a year. He joined GDMPC in 2010 and his previous loan from it that was used to purchase spare parts for his motor was successfully repaid. Recently, he has requested a loan to purchase additional grocery goods and rice to sell. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to save as a reserve for future emergencies.

loans.use: to purchase additional grocery goods and rice to sell

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en:
Lorna is 53 years old and married with one kid.

Lorna works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 9,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stocks of groceries to sell.

Lorna has borrowed and repaid two loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for nine years and also earns an income from clothing sales.

Lorna aspires to repair and renovate her family home.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Rosa Isabel

texts.es:
Rosa, invertirá en el negocio de venta de ropa y vitaminas, ella trabajo muy bien con el crédito anterior obtuvo buenas ganancias, su negocio creció, cancelo sus cuotas y cambio sus condiciones de vida.
Comprara ropa para dama, niños (diferentes estilos, colores y tallas) y vitaminas, con esto fortalecerá su negocio y lo mantendrá activo.
Gracias a los cambios que ha tenido en su economía su familia gaza de una buena alimentación, salud y edución.
texts.en:
Rosa will invest in her clothing sales business and vitamins.  She did well with her previous loan and earned a good profit.  Her business grew, she paid off her loan, and she changed her quality of life. 
Rosa will now purchase women's and children's clothing (different styles, colors and sizes) and vitamins.  These purchases will strengthen her business and keep it active. 
Thanks to the changes in her finances, Rosa's family is enjoying better nutrition, health and education.

loans.use: to purchase women's and children's clothing (different styles, colors and sizes) and vitamins.

loans.name: Anastasia

texts.en: Anastasia is 36 years old and she is married. She has a kiosk to generate income for her family. She has been thinking how to run a big business, but she does not have enough working capital. She has been involving herself in business activities since 2002 with her own working capital. She felt better when she applied for her first loan, and she is applying now for her second loan of $1,000.00 She will buy some additional supplies to keep in her store such as eggs, noodles, sugar, coffee, salt, cigarettes, water, Fanta, Coca-cola, Sprite, Sagiko and body lotion. She is happy that TRM (Tuba Rai Metin) offers loan to poor people.

loans.use: To buy eggs, noodles, sugar, coffee, salt, cigarettes, water, Fanta, Coca-cola, Sprite, Sagiko and body lotion.

loans.name: Genie

texts.en:
Genie is 36 years old. She is believed to be very responsible with her household obligations, since she has always been known to provide the best for her family. Currently, she lives with her husband, who is a motorcycle driver, and her six children. She is a farmer who plants rice, corn, vegetables and beans.

Genie wants to increase sales. Consequently, she has requested a loan that will enable her to purchase seeds, compost and fertilizer, among other items, so that she can continue to put bread on the table in her home.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, compost and fertilizer

location.town: Sindangan - Dicoyong, Sindangan, Zamboanga del Nor

loans.name: Arlyn

texts.en:
Arlyn is 53 years old, married and resident of Dullan, Aloran, Misamis Occidental, Mindanao in the Philippines. From her desire to help the family, she engaged in a buying and selling business with PHP 3,000 for starting capital and she was able to expand it with the help of Paglaum Cooperative. Aside from financial assistance, she was able to generate savings and enjoys the benefit given by the co-op. She became a member in good standing and has taken out several loans. 

Now she is applying for 49,900 PHP to restock inventories for her business. She wants to buy bags of rice, cases of soft drinks, soap, noodles and others. Through this, she hopes to increase her income and from it she can then sustain the needs of her family. In the future, she one day wants to own a space near a public market where she could display her stocks with convenience. She will be fully satisfied if she sees her children finish their studies.

loans.use: to buy bags of rice, cases of soft drinks, soap, noodles and other products for sale

loans.name: Esperanza

texts.en:
Esperanza is from Maralag, Dumingag, Zamboanga del Sur. She is 47 years old and is married.  She has three children. 

In 2013, Esperanza applied her membership with PMPC.  Hearing all the benefits, she never hesitated to become one. She maintains the status of being a member in good standing and repays her obligations in a timely manner.

Recently, Esperanza is asking a financial assistance of Php 15,000 to finance her farming activities such as land preparation (plowing, leveling & cleaning of dikes) and seed bed preparation (mounting of beds, seed sowing & maintenance). Through this, she hopes to increase her income and be of help in the expansion of the farming business.  She has found assistance for their financial needs through Paglaum Multi Purpose Cooperative, and she is very thankful with all her heart.

loans.use: To finance farming activities such as land preparation and seedbed preparation.

loans.name: Ingrid

texts.en:
Ingrid, age 40, is a rice farmer. She has earned a living through farming rice for the past 15 years. She and her husband have two children and live in Upper Bayao Tukuran ZDS.
 
Ingrid has been a member of PMPC for seven years. She is requesting a loan in order to buy fertilizer for her rice field.

In the future, Ingrid hopes to buy a delivery truck to use for delivering her rice.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her rice field

location.town: Pagadian-Upper Bayao Tukuran Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Chanthoeurn

texts.en:
Chanthoeurn is a 33-year-old woman. She has a common-law partner and two children. She lives with them in a thatched house in Prey Chhor district, Kampong Cham province. Chanthoeurn and her husband help each other manage their farm and get a decent income, but it is not enough for the family, so her husband is also involved in providing transportation services to make additional income. 

Chanthoeurn and her husband are seeking other ways to improve their income, and now they want to start up a kind of family business, renting out microphones and speakers to those who need them for a ceremony at their home. The start-up business will need an initial capital of 300 US dollars for the purchase of microphones, speakers, and wires. This will increase the income of their family. She expresses her thanks to all kind lenders for their loan.

loans.use: to buy microphones, speakers, and wires for her start-up rental business

loans.name: Rithy

texts.en:
Rithy is 25 years old and a loving father of a small child, living with his family in Baray district, Kampong Thom province. Rithy is a construction worker, who earns a daily wage of KHR 25,000 per day to help his wife share the costs of living. He has been working in the construction industry for nearly five years. He mentioned that his income is not stable because occasionally there is no work to do at the fields, so it is a tough time to feed his family.

At the moment, Rithy is building his own house to provide a safe and comfortable place for his wife and child. He still needs some materials to complete the unfinished parts of this house, so he is asking for a loan in the amount of KHR 2,000,000 to buy planks of wood, nails, and other tools to help him in this construction. Rithy is very happy and thankful for the loan funded via the program like Kiva to enable low-income families to improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to buy planks of wood, nails, and other tools to help him in the construction of the borrower's house

loans.name: Lot

texts.en:
Lot is a 28-year-old married woman. She lives with her lovely husband and two children in the Santuk district of Cambodia.

Currently she is in a business of raising pigs. She has been involved in this career for the past 13 years. According to her experience in this field, she is able to maintain her pigs and sells at a good price upon maturity.

Her husband also contributes his income generated by collecting and selling firewood into the markets of the province. He uses two animals for pulling his firewood trailers. Unluckily, his trailer wheel was wrong and unable to move, so Lot, his wife, would like to take out a loan in the amount of 400,000 KHR to buy a new trailer wheel to replace the old one. Through the loan help, Lot’s husband will be able to continue selling his firewood and hopes to make a better profit.

loans.use: to buy a new trailer wheel to replace the old one

loans.name: Jerlyn

texts.en:
Jerlyn is a married woman with two children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Jerlyn is 38 years old and has two children who are in school.

Jerlyn has a general store business in the Philippines. Jerlyn requested a loan of PHP 12,000 through NWTF to purchase more items like detergent soap, snack foods, soft-drinks, juice and noodles to sell.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her general store business.

Jerlyn has been in this business for six years. In the future, she  would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more items like detergent soap, snack foods, soft-drinks, juice and noodles to sell

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en:
Rosemarie, age 34, runs a general store to earn her living. She has been in this business for three years and sells a variety of grocery items such as noodles, sardines, and bread. She and her husband have one child, who attends school. Rosemarie works hard to help support the family.

Rosemarie has requested a PhP 5,000 loan through NWTF. She will use her loan funds to purchase more grocery items to offer for sale.

In the future, Rosemarie would like to build and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more grocery items to offer for sale

loans.name: Melanie

texts.en:
Melanie runs a fishing business to earn her living. She earns an additional income from food vending. She and her husband have three children, and she works hard to support her family.

Melanie is requesting PhP 5,000 through NWTF. She will use her loan funds to buy fishing nets and other equipment for her business.

Melanie has been sustaining her business activities through her past two loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream, which is to save enough money to expand her business and allow her to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets and other equipment for her business

loans.name: Matautu

texts.en: Matautu is a 60-year-old married woman with seven children. She has a taxi business which serves in her village and nearby villages. She is requesting this loan to buy new tires, oil fluid, engine oil, power steering, and brakes. Matautu joined SPBD in 2012 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy new tires, oil fluid, engine oil, power steering, and brakes

loans.name: Saipa

texts.en:
Saipa is thankful for the financial assistance extended to her. She was able to buy more stocks of used but quality clothes for her business, which has been running for seven years now. Her loan was also helpful in the education of her children. Her income from business assisted in their everyday household expenditures. She and her husband are working hard to provide for their everyday needs.

She would like to apply for another 20,000 PHP loan to buy additional stocks of used but quality shirts, shorts, blouses, and pants. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from business will definitely help sustain her family’s daily needs and children’s education expense. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 

Saipa hopes that her business will be stronger and have another branch. She dreams that her children will finish their studies. She meets  with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and draw strength and inspiration from studying the word of God.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group comprises 15 to 30 community partners who gather to study the word of God, build social capital and pay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for additional stocks of used but quality shirts, shorts, blouses, and pants

loans.name: Solie

texts.en:
Solid, age 34, runs a general store business to earn a living. She has operated her business for 10 years and earns about PhP 1,900 per month. She and her husband have two children and live in Señor, Sinacaban.
 
Solie has been a member of PMPC for five years. She is requesting a loan in the amount of PhP 10,500 in order to buy additional goods to sell in her store, specifically biscuits, crackers, yogurt drinks, sweets and candies, assorted breads, noodles, soaps, and shampoos.

In the future, Solie hopes to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy biscuits, crackers, yogurt drinks, sweets and candies, assorted breads, noodles, soaps, and shampoos to offer for sale

loans.name: Belinda

texts.en:
Belinda runs a retail grocery store business in her village to earn a living. She has operated her business for almost 28 years. Before this, she worked in a salon, offering hairdressing, manicures, and pedicures. She and her husband have four grown children, three of whom are now married.

Belinda is requesting a loan in the amount of PhP 10,000 in order to buy grocery items such as biscuits, drinks, noodles, coffee, and sugar to offer for sale. Her loan funds will help her to improve and expand her business and will help her to earn a higher income.

loans.use: to buy grocery items such as biscuits, drinks, noodles, coffee, and sugar to offer for sale

loans.name: Garing

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Garing works hard to support her family. She has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from a buy-and-sell nipa (palm) roofing business. Garing is borrowing 29,500 PHP through NWTF to pay for the labor, repair and maintenance of her motorcycle for her motorcycle transport business.

Garing has been sustaining her business activities through her past seven loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her to attain her dream to save enough money so that she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to pay for the labor, repair and maintenance of her motorcycle.

loans.name: Ednalyn

texts.en:
Ednalyn works hard to support her family.  She is married and has a business, selling fish in the Philippines.  Ednalyn has been in this business for two years now and earns additional income from a tricycle transportation business.

Ednalyn has requested a loan of 13,000 PHP through NWTF in order to buy more seafood to sell to her customers.

In the future, Ednalyn would like to save money in order to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more seafood to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Dexter

texts.en: Dexter, a 23-year-old bachelor, operates a 'sari-sari' store and earns about PHP 400 daily. Generated income is usually saved for the education of his siblings. Now, he would like to increase his income daily, and that's why he is requesting additional capital amounting to PHP 5,000 to buy canned goods, noodles, soft drinks, candies and spices. He knows that with the additional working capital he requested, he could further increase his usual earnings and make his store a stable source of income.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, noodles, soft drinks, candies and spices for his general store

loans.name: Corazon

texts.en:
Corazon is 40 years old and married with three children. Two of her children are in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. 

Corazon has an oyster culture business in the Philippines. Corazon requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy bamboo, binders, fishing nets and other equipment.

Corazon has been in this business for three years. In the future, Corazon would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy bamboo, binders, fishing nets and other equipment.

loans.name: Lia

texts.en:
Lia runs a small stall which sells snacks, drinks, mobile phone airtime credits, and bill payments. Lia lives in Bandung, a semi-urban area three hours from Jakarta. Lia is married and has children.

Lia began working with Ruma one month ago because she wanted to increase her income and business by selling mobile airtime and serving bill payments. She feels really excited to expand her business in selling mobile phone airtime credits and serving bill payments. For the last month, she has made around $ 10 - 20 per day in sales on average (just mobile phone airtime credit sales). Recently, she took a loan to get a printer from KIVA to support her business in selling mobile phone airtime credits and serving bill payments (household electricity payments).

loans.use: To process more mobile phone credit sales and bill payment transactions

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria is thankful for the financial assistance extended to her. She was able to buy more supplies and merchandise products for her direct selling business which she has been running for fifteen years now. Her loan has also been helpful in the education of her children. Income from her business helped pay their everyday expenses at home. She and her husband are working hard to provide for their everyday expenses.

She would like to apply for another 10,000 PHP loan to buy more merchandise items and products to increase her inventory. The more items she has on display and available on hand, the better. More items to sell will result in better profit, which will definitely help her to sustain her children’s education and daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Gloria hopes that her business will continue to flourish and dreams of having a better future. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her life and business every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to buy more merchandise items and products like clothing, footwear, undergarments and cosmetics needed in her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy oil, meat, rice, beans, and vegetables.

loans.name: Martha Alicia

texts.es:
Martha, le ha llegado la oportunidad de invertir en su negocio y comprara ropa para dama, caballero y niños (variedad de estilos, colores y tallas); ella al crédito anterior le saco mucho provecho por que la inversión que hizo le dio como resultado más clientes nuevos y satisfechos, sus ganancias fueron mejores, cancelo sus cuotas y apoya a su familia.
Su familia sigue unida, no ha tenido algún problema que le evite seguir trabajando, su familia goza de buena salud.
texts.en:
Martha has the opportunity to invest in her business and purchase clothing for ladies, gentlemen and children (in a variety of styles, colors, and sizes). 

She got a lot out of the last loan she took out, gaining new satisfied customers. Martha's earnings were better, allowing her to pay her debts and aid her family.

Martha's family remains united and she has had no problem that would prevent her from working. Her family enjoys good health.

loans.use: buy clothing for ladies, gentlemen, and children to sell.

loans.name: Yensi Mabel

texts.es:
Doña Yensi Mabel tiene una edad de 27 años, casada la cual goza de una excelente salud con mucha energía y mucho entusiasmo al momento de ejercer su trabajo, madre de 4 hijos los cuales estudian en diferentes grados de educación en la escuela de la comunidad donde ella  y su esposo habitan. Su único apoyo es su esposo el cual ejerce las actividades más pesadas y largas del día como la limpieza, la aplicación de abono foliares, lavado, secado del grano entre otros mientras ella colabora con la recolección del grano. Fue gracias a su esposo que ella aprendió a trabajar la tierra ya que la familia de él, es agricultora con el cual ejerce desde hace 3 años dicha actividad. Sus clientes son los diferentes compradores e intermediarios que llegan a la zona en busca del producto para poder revenderlo en el mercado local y nacional. Uno de los mayores problemas con esta actividad es la variación de precios en los insumos que al café se le aplican ya que la competencia no es problema para ella y su esposo. Sus cultivos están ubicado a 200 metros de distancia de su casa de habitación al cual se trasladan a caminando en familia permitiéndoles estar más pendiente de sus cultivos y de los problemas que estos puedan presentar.
Doña Yensi Mabel solicita financiamiento para la compra de 1800 plantillas para cultivar, 8 sacos de abono, 2 litros de foliares, 8 litros de boro para poder asistir a sus cultivos de café y poder venderlo en el mercado a un muy buen precio.
Sus metas son las de poder tener un cultivo sano, libre de plagas de insectos dañinos entre otros que puedan perjudicar el trabajo de muchos días, horas, etc. y perder la cosecha. Como madre ver a sus hijos convertidos en hombres y mujeres de provecho con carreras universitarias que les puedan ayudar a generar fuentes de empleo y a ser mejores cada día.
texts.en:
Yensi Mabel is 27 years old, and is married. She is in excellent health and brings a lot of energy and enthusiasm to her work. She is a mother to four children, who study in different year groups at the school in the community where she and her husband live. Her only support is her husband, who does the hardest and longest work of the day such as the cleaning, application of compost and foliar products, the washing and drying of the bean and others while she helps with picking the beans. 

It was thanks to her husband that she learned to work the land, because his family are farmers, with whom she has exercised this activity for three years. Her customers are the different buyers and intermediaries who visit the area looking for the product to resell it on the local and international markets. One of the biggest problems with this business is the variation in prices in the inputs that are applied to coffee, as competition isn't a problem for her and her husband. Her crops are located 200 metres from her home, which they get to walking as a family, which allows them to better care for her crops and the problems they might have. 

Yensi Mabel is requesting a loan to buy 1800 small coffee plants to grow, 8 sacks of compost, 2 litres of foliar products, 8 litres of boron for her coffee crops so that she can sell them in the market for a very good price. Her goals are to have a healthy crop, free from plagues of harmful insects and others that can damage many hours and days work, and lead to the harvest being lost. As a mother, she also wants to see her children become people of worth, with university degrees which can help them to generate sources of income and improve every day.

loans.use: to buy agricultural inputs for her coffee plants.

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en:
Daniel is single with an only child and he manages his own piggery to earn a  living. He has been doing this for ten years.  He joined Kiva partner GDMPC and gained access to micro finance services. 

Daniel has borrowed a loan in order to renovate his pig shelter. He wants to expand his piggery in order to earn more returns for the future of his family.

loans.use: to renovate his pig shelter.

loans.name: Juan Ovidio

texts.es:
Juan, está optando por invertir en la siembra de granos básicos, para comprar abono, herbicidas, insecticidas y también cancelara los mozos que le ayuden a recoger la cosecha, con el préstamo anterior el obtuvo una cosecha más abundante, sus ingresos fueron mejores.
Sus condiciones de vida cambiaron, su familia está saludable y todos lo apoyan para seguir trabajando y salir adelante.
texts.en: Juan has decided to invest in planting basic grains and will buy manure, herbicides, insecticides and also pay the workers who help him to collect the harvest. With the help of the previous loan, he obtained a more abundant harvest, and this improved his income. His living conditions improved, his family is healthy, and everyone supports him to keep on working and to move forward in life.

loans.use: to buy manure, herbicides, insectides and to pay labor costs.

loans.name: Jairo Denys

texts.es:
Jairo, está casado, vive con su esposa y sus dos hijos, hace seis años gracias a sus amistades el estableció un negocio propio que consiste en alquiler de sillas y mesas de alquiler, además es enfermero en un hospital, el es el responsable de generar ingresos para el sustento de su familia.
Comprara mesas, sillas, manteles y repuestos para su vehículo, así contara con más inventario para ofrecer al público que hace uso de sus servicios, tendrá más ingresos y así podrá ir cancelando sus cuotas.
Sueña con cubrir todas las necesidades de su familia, ampliar el negocio, y brindarles una educación superior a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Jairo is married and lives with his wife and their two children. Six years ago, thanks to friendships he established his own business that consists of renting chairs and tables. Additionally he is a nurse in a hospital. He is the one responsible for generating income for supporting his family. 

He will buy tables, chairs, tablecloths, and replacement parts for his vehicle. In that way, he will have a bigger inventory to offer to the public that makes use of his services. He will have more income and in that way be able to make his payments. 

He dreams of covering all of the necessities of his family, expanding the business, and providing higher education for his children.

loans.use: to buy tables, chairs, tablecloths, and replacement parts for his vehicle.

loans.name: Jeanette

texts.en:
Jeanette is single and has a business selling ready-to-wear clothing in the Philippines.

Jeanette requested a PHP 6000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more stocks of items like pants, blouses, bags and slippers.

Jeanette has been in this business for two years now, and also earns additional income from a general store.

In the future, Jeanette would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of clothes for her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fertilizer, seeds, and herbicides.

loans.name: Herna

texts.en:
As a married mother of four children, Herna works hard to support her family.

She has a food market business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from selling ready-to-wear clothing. Herna is borrowing PHP 10,000 through Kiva partner NWTF in order to buy more spices to sell from her food stall.

Herna has been sustaining her business activities through her past two loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more spices to sell from her food stall.

loans.name: Modou

texts.fr:
Monsieur Modou, âgé de 33 ans, gère une boutique d’alimentations générales et cela depuis des années. Il est marié et père d’un petit garçon de 5 ans. Il habite dans un quartier pas loin du centre ville et c’est la bas qu’il a installé son commerce pour atteindre le maximum de clients.
Modou vient pour la troisième fois afin de pouvoir bénéficier d’un crédit qui lui permettra de remplir sa boutique de marchandises surtout celles demandées par sa clientèle. Modou offre une large variété de bagages divers. Il a divisé sa boutique en trois rubriques : denrées alimentaires,  produits cosmétiques et petit matériel domestique en plastiques (chaises enfants, pot de chambre, bol…). Les cinq cent mille lui serviront à acheter de chacune de ses marchandises et de mettre dans sa boutique. Grâce aux revenus de son activité, il nourrit sa famille et augmente son stock.
Modou rêve d’ouvrir d’autres boutiques et de diversifier davantage son commerce.
texts.en:
Mr. Modou, aged 33, has been running a general store for years. He is a married father with a 5-year-old son. He lives in a district near the downtown where he set up his business to reach as many customers as possible. 

Modou is here for the third time to take out a loan enabling him to supply his store with merchandise, especially what is demanded by his customers.  Modou sells a large variety of goods. He divided up his store into three departments: basic groceries, cosmetic products, and sundry plastic goods for the home (baby chairs, chamber pots, bowls, …)  The loan of 500,000 francs will be used to purchase merchandise for his store. Thanks to the revenues from his business, he is feeding his family and augmenting his inventory. Modou dreams of opening other stores and diversifying his business.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise to supply his store

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
Marilou is 46 years old and lives in Dela Paz, Clarin, Philippines. She is married with two children. 

Marilou works in the fish industry and sells fish for a living. She has been doing this for 10 years. She has requested a loan to purchase additional materials used for the repair of her house such as plywood, common nails, lumber, cement, plain sheets, corrugated bars, etc. Marilou has been a member of PMPC for three years. In the future, Marilou hopes to financially support her immediate family members.

loans.use: to purchase materials to repair her house .

loans.name: Juana

texts.en:
Juana is married with three children.  Juana  is 53-years-old and lives in Señor, Sinacaban, Philippines.

Juana sells a variety of products in order to earn a living and has had this business for 10 years. Each month, she earns PHP 1,500 doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of 6,000 in order to purchase additional goods to sell such as noodles, canned goods, eggs, iodized salt, monosodium glutamates, other seasonings, spices, etc.

Juana has been a member of Kiva partner PMPC for eight years.  In the future, Juana hope to improve and expand her business to earn more profit.

loans.use: to purchase additional goods to sell such as noodles, canned goods, eggs, iodized salts ,monosodium glutamates, seasonings, spices, etc.

loans.name: Regina

texts.en:
Regina is married with three children. Regina is 49-years-old and lives in Señor, Sinacaban, Philippines.

Regina is a farmer and grows corn crops in order to earn a living. She has been doing this for 10 years. She has requested a loan in order to purchase additional fertilizers and other chemicals such as pesticides used for pest control.

Regina has been a member of Kiva partner PMPC for eight years. In the future, Regina hopes to improve her corn plantation to produce more profit.

loans.use: to purchase additional fertilizers and other chemicals such as pesticides used for pest control.

loans.name: Najma Group

texts.en:
This group is called Najma and consists of four ladies, where live in Sana`a, Yemen. They work hard to offer a good life for their families. They took out a loan of 120,000 YER. 

Najma is the group coordinator, a 31-year-old married woman who has children, most of whom are school. She is a happy woman who treats everyone well because of her opportunities to get ahead. She, like many people, has had good times and bad ones, and has gotten ahead despite whatever stands in her way. 

She would like to improve her house, so she applied for a loan of 30,000 YER from AMB to buy furniture, thus making the house more comfortable for her family. 

With great strength and dedication, she has become a better person.

loans.use: to buy furniture for her house

loans.name: Leni

texts.en:
Leni is married with four children. Leni  is 47-years-old and lives in Tipan, Sinacaban, Philippines.

Leni  is a farmer and grows corn crops in order to earn a living. She has been doing this for 20 years. She has requested a loan to purchase additional fertilizers and other chemicals such as insecticides and pesticides to prevent attack from corn pests.

Leni has been a member of Kiva partner PMPC for six years. In the future, Leni hopes to expand her corn field to gain more profit.

loans.use: to purchase additional fertilizers and other chemicals such as insecticides and pesticides to prevent attack from corn pests.

loans.name: Elnora

texts.en:
Elnora is married with four children. She is 43 years old and lives in Dela Paz, Clarin, Philippines.

Elnora sells a variety of goods to earn a living and has had this business for seven years. Each month she earns PHP 3,500 doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to purchase additional products such as canned goods, noodles, candies, junk foods, drinks and beverages, assorted breads, biscuits, crackers, toothpaste, detergents, beauty soaps, etc.

Elnora has been a member of PMPC for eight months.  In the future, Elnora hopes to financially support her immediate family members.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
Ahmad is from Iraq. He is 36 years old, married, and has 3 children. Ahmad works hard to provide for his family's needs all by himself.

Ahmad is a grocer and owns a small grocery store where he provides his neighborhood with dairy products, canned foods, snacks, drinks and detergents. He has been in this field ever since he was a teenager. After gaining all the needed experience and knowing the market, Ahmad established his own independent business in 2009, and now he has a hired employee already. Ahmad is well-known in the area, thanks to his good products and affordable prices.

Ahmad is requesting a loan of 2,400 USD. He will use this loan to renovate his grocery store. Ahmad is aiming to grow his business and increase his profits so he may be able to educate his children and promise them a bright future.

loans.use: to renovate his grocery store.

loans.name: Rema

texts.en:
Remia is 58 years old, married and the mother with four children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Remia has an egg retailing business in the Philippines. Remia requested a PHP 6,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more stocks of egg to sell.

Remia has been in this business for 20 years. In the future, Remia would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more eggs to sell.

loans.name: Hechiel

texts.en:
Hechiel is 34 years old and lives in Cebedo Aguada, Ozamis City. She is married with two children. For a year now, Hechiel has operated a shop that sells used clothing or “ukay-ukay”. A member of PMPC for less than a year, she has requested a loan to buy more used clothing to sell.

In the future, Hechiel hopes to expand her business into the neighboring cities.

loans.use: to purchase addiitonal stocks of used clothing to sell

loans.name: Safia

texts.en: Safia is 46 years old and works from home as a tailor. She has been in this line of work for two years now and is proud to be contributing to her household income. When Safia was not earning money, her family was going through a severe financial crisis that compelled her to use her stitching skills in a productive manner. Her husband was the sole bread winner of the family so she felt obligated to change her family’s living standards. Her hard work helped her establish a good clientele but she is having difficulty in fulfilling large orders. So she has requested a loan of PKR 35,000 to purchase a new stitching machine with some spools of thread in various colors. In this way, she will be able to stitch up more dresses in less time. Safia is in her seventh loan cycle with good repayment history.

loans.use: to purchase a new stitching machine with some spools of thread in various colors.

loans.name: Nighat

texts.en:
Nighat, age 38, is a mother of five children. Her husband, who owns a tailoring shop in the market, is a very hardworking person with excellent tailoring skills. This is the only source of income for the family.

He needs to purchase tailoring material and a new tailoring machine as the previous one had stopped working. This new machine will help him to continue his work efficiently and professionally. However, due to lack of money he finds it difficult. 

Nighat is requesting a loan, from Kiva partner BRAC Pakistan, with the goal of helping her husband. Nighat is feeling happy that she will be able to help her husband with the loan amount. She is thankful to Kiva lenders and to BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to purchase a sewing machine.

loans.name: Rowena

texts.en: Rowena is 43 years old. She is married and has two children, both of whom are studying. She lives in Mabini, Baliangao Misamis Occidental. Rowena has been engaged in a sari-sari store business for three years and earns a mothly income of 4,500 PHP. She requested a new loan to purchase two sacks of rice to sell. She has been a CUMI member of Paglaum MPC since 2001. She dreams of having a big savings from her business and being able to repay her loan.

loans.use: To purchase two sacks of rice to sell

loans.name: Artesanos Del Oro Group

texts.es: Artesanos del Oro es un grupo integrado por cinco miembros ellos viven en un lugar que lleva el nombre de El Oro pues anteriormente se sacaba Oro de las minas, también es un lugar muy conocido por un vagón el cual funciona ahora como un restaurante.  Comento uno de los integrantes del grupo “Ese vagón solo fue un cachito del tren que se quedo ahí pero ahora funciona como restaurante la gente lo conoce muy bien, lo mejor del lugar son los ricos cafés” El Municipio El Oro es conocido como Pueblo Mágico, nombre que se otorgó a distintas ciudades coloniales en todo el país. Don J. Carmen, o Carmelo como mejor lo conocen, quien es integrante del grupo “Artesanos del Oro” tiene 52 años de edad, está casado con la señora Rosaura desde hace varios años juntos han formado una familia con ocho hijos de los cuales aun depende tres  y se encuentran estudiando, El señor Carmelo tiene una pequeña carpintería desde hace siete años esta vez está solicitando un crédito para comprar madera, triplay, resistol, clavos etc. para la elaboración de sus muebles como roperos, cocinas integrales, mesas, sillas , platica que inicio su actividad porque fue uno de los oficios que aprendió cuando era joven, “Gracias al crédito he podido mantener su carpintería sin los créditos de VisionFund y KIVA no hubiera podido continuar con mi actividad”, su dificultad más grande es la falta de empleo en su municipio en donde vive el poco trabajo obtenido. El trabajo de Don Carmelo solo es por pedido si le llegan a solicitar algún mueble lo realiza, aunque también está considerando salir a otros lugares para captar más clientes. Sus ganancias le ayudan mucho porque así puede solventar gastos de educación para sus niños porque quiere seguir ayudando con los gastos de educación de sus hijos para que puedan terminar una carrera profesional. Así como Don Carmelo necesita de su crédito los integrantes del grupo también requieren de su crédito para invertir en su actividades económicas Don Antonio invertirá en medicamento y alimento para su veterinaria, Abigail invertirá en artesanía de latón, Angélica invertirá en alimento para cerdos, Magali compra de Ocoxal.
texts.en:
‘Artesanos de Oro’ [gold artisans] is a group comprised of five members.  They live in a place called ‘El Oro’ [The Gold] because gold was previously taken from the mines.  The place is also well-known for a railroad car, which now functions as a restaurant.  One of the members of the group said, “This railroad car was only a little part of the train that was left here.  However, it now functions as a restaurant that is well-known by the people.  The delicious cafes are the best of the place”.

The El Oro municipality is known as ‘Pueblo Mágico’ [Magic Town], a name given to different colonial cities in the country.  J. Carmen, or Carmelo, as he is better known, is a member of the Artesanos del Oro group.  He is 52 years old, and he has been married to Rosaura for several years.  Together they have formed a family with eight children.  Three of the children are still dependent upon them and are in school.

Carmelo has had a small carpentry business for seven years.  This time he is requesting a loan to buy wood, particle board, Resistol glue, and nails, etc. in order to make furniture like wardrobes, kitchen cabinets, tables, and chairs.  He says that he started his business activity because it was one of the trades he learned when he was young.  “Thanks to the loan, I have been able to maintain my carpentry business.  Without the loans from VisionFund and Kiva, I would not have been able to continue with my business activity.”

His biggest difficulty is the lack of employment in the municipality where he lives and the little work obtained.  Carmelo’s work is only by order.  If they come to request a piece of furniture from him, he makes it.  He is also considering setting out for other places in order to get more customers.  His earnings help him a lot.  This way he is able to pay his children’s educational expenses.  He wants to continue helping with his children’s educational expenses so that they are able to graduate from college.

That is why Carmelo needs his loan, and the members of the group also need their loan to invest in their business activities.  Antonio will buy medication and food for his veterinary business, Abigail will invest in her brass handicrafts, Angélica will buy feed for pigs, and Magali will buy ‘ocoxal’ [leaf used for handicrafts].

loans.use: to buy wood and particle board.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria is 50 years old and has six children. Victoria is married and two of her children are still in school.

Victoria is in the agricultural business raising livestock in the Philippines. Victoria requested a PHP 16,000 loan through NWTF to purchase vitamins and additional livestock for her business.

Victoria has been raising livestock for 17 years now and has borrowed in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Victoria would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase vitamins and additional livestock for her business

loans.name: Mahmoud

texts.en: Mahmoud was born in 1988. He is single and lives in a sector in Jordan called Marka with his parents and five siblings. Mahmoud has been making ash wood baskets and ash wood trays for one year. He started his project selling a small quantity of them to his neighbors and close friends, and he found it profitable. Now he wants to buy a larger quantity of ash to raise his productivity and income to start supporting his family. But he doesn't have enough money to do so. For this reason, he applied for this youth loan.

loans.use: To buy a larger quantity of ash wood for his business

loans.name: Sayeda

texts.en:
Sayeda, a 28-year-old hard-working woman, lives in Pakistan with her husband and four children. Her husband is a tailor by profession. He wants to generate more income by purchasing a new sewing machine. Sayeda will extend her business if she gets a good amount of profit in the future. 

Sayeda has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan to purchase a sewing machine to stitch up more dresses and to satisfy the needs of her clients more professionally. She hopes, with the help of this loan, to reach her desired net income and be able to save for the future. She dreams of giving her children a quality education.

loans.use: to purchase a sewing machine to stitch up more dresses

loans.name: Nafees

texts.en:
Nafees is a 25-year-old man who lives with his family in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Since 2005, Nafees has been running his own embroidery store near his house, which is a very successful business for his family. He is an active borrower of BRAC Pakistan. 

He currently needs to purchase some new embroidery products for his store. But due to financial constraints, he finds it difficult. Therefore, he has requested a loan of 120,000 PKR from Kiva's partner, BRAC Pakistan. This will not only help him to grow his business but will also increase his net income and savings. He is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy new embroidery products for the borrower's embroidery store

loans.name: Gulnaz

texts.en:
Gulnaz is a 22-year-old unmarried lady who is supporting her family by running business manufacturing carpets. She has been involved in this work for a period of about seven years. She offers various handmade carpets in different colors, and she has become famous by providing good quality carpets in her community. She is contentedly doing it for the sake of her family.

It’s her second year with Kashf Foundation. She is satisfied with the support from it.  Currently she has applied for a loan of PKR 35,000 to buy good quality wool, nylon, polyester, and polypropylene fibers to increase her sales. She expects a boost in her earnings and wishes to spend it on the betterment of her family members.

loans.use: to buy good quality wool, nylon, polyester, and polypropylene fibers.

loans.name: Avelino

texts.en:
Avelino operates a business providing transportation in his community to earn a living. He carries passengers and baggage to the customer's destination.  He has been doing this for more than ten years. 

Recently, he borrowed from GDMPC microcredit to cover the costs of maintaining hs motorcycle to provide better service. In the future, he wants to improve his motor transport and have a comfortable living with his family.

loans.use: to pay to maiintain his motorcycle.

loans.name: Cristy

texts.en:
Cristy is thankful for the financial assistance extended to her, as she was able to buy the raw materials needed in her tailoring business. Her loan was also helpful in the education of her children. Her income from business assisted in their everyday household expenditures. Her husband is a carpenter and is helping her in providing for their family. She also has a direct-selling business and sells mineral water for additional income.
 
She would like to apply for another PHP 15,000 loan to buy additional supplies of raw materials like fabric, cloth, thread, needles, and other materials needed in her tailoring. Her profits from business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs and her children’s education. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Cristy dreams that all her businesses will last longer, and she hopes to give her family a good future. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members weekly to share stories of their work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay their microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for fabric, cloth, thread, needles, and other materials needed in her tailoring.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is 53 years old, and she lives in Dung-an culo Molave Zamboanga del Sur. She is married, with one child.         

Teresita has a internet cafe business, where she earns about PHP 10,000 each month doing this type of work. She has a requested a loan to buy another computer unit.

Teresita has been a member of PMPC for two years. In the future, she hopes to improve her business and build another internet cafe some day.

loans.use: to buy more equipment for her internet cafe

loans.name: Maria Del Carmen

texts.es:
María, invertirá en la compra de lociones, maquillaje, labiales, cremas corporales, ropa, etc., se ha visto muy beneficiada con el crédito que se le dio antes, mejoro su inventario, gano nuevos clientes, ella pudo estabilizarse económicamente y no tuvo ningún problema para seguir trabajando y pagar sus deudas.
María mejoro mucho las condiciones de vida que le brindaba a su familia, les da mejor alimentación y salud.
texts.en:
María will invest in the purchase of lotions, makeup, lipstick, body lotion, clothing etc.  She benefited greatly from the credit she was previously given.  She improved her inventory, earned new customers and became more financially stable.  María didn't have any trouble continuing to work and pay off her debts.
María greatly improved the quality of life she was able to offer her family; she now offers them better nutrition and health.

loans.use: to purchase lotions, makeup, lipstick, body lotion, clothing etc.

loans.name: Om-Anwar Group

texts.en:
Om-Anwar group consists of three women from Al-Hodeida, Yemen. 

Haya is 31 years old, and an illiterate woman. She lives with her family in the city of Al-Hodeida. Her family conditions are bad, so she has to help her husband in paying for all their living expenses. She is a door-to-door seller of clothes and perfumes. She has been selling for three years.

Haya's business is making a good profit, so she decided to expand her business. Therefore, she applied for a loan from Al-Amal, to buy more clothes, incense and perfumes to sell. This will really help the family to improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to buy more clothes, incense and perfumes to sell

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en: Mohammad was born in 1995. He lives in a sector in Jordan called Karak with his parents and 8 siblings. Mohammad has been selling computer parts, CDs, and headphones for 9 months. He started his business by buying a small quantity of products. Now he wants to buy a larger quantity of CDs and computer parts so he can increase his profit and income and start supporting his family financially. But as he doesn't have enough money for the purchase, he applied for this youth loan.

loans.use: To buy more CDs and computer parts for his business

loans.name: Reema

texts.en:
Reema was born in 1988. She is single and has 5 siblings. Her father works at a governmental entity.

Reema currently works in agriculture. She has also been selling home products for 3 years and started her business with a small quantity of products. Now she wants to increase the amount of home products she sells in order to increase her profit and income and thus provide good financial support for her family. But as she doesn’t have enough money to do so, she applied for this youth loan.  Because Reema is a conservative woman, she asked her mother to take her place in this photo.

loans.use: To buy more home products for her business

loans.name: Marialyn

texts.en:
Marialyn is married, with five children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur.  She is 49 years old and has one child, who is still in school.

Marialyn has a general store business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to buy more stock to sell in her general store.

Marialyn has been in this business for 20 years. In the future, Marialyn would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stock for her general store

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase merchandise for her bazaar for the Christmas season

loans.name: Barrio La Cañada Group

texts.es: El grupo “Barrio La Cañada” está integrado por ocho mujeres todas muy trabajadoras con muchas ganas de poder sobresalir en sus negocios y sacar adelante a su familia, se conocen desde hace ya varios años con el tiempo han llegado a construir una gran y sincera amistad. Ellas viven en una comunidad mazahua algunas personas aun se comunican en su lengua indígena, ya son muy pocas las mujeres que aun lucen sus trajes típicos caracterizados por sus colores muy llamativos. Algo muy característico de la comunidad donde se ubica el grupo es su pastizal muy verde y los hermosos paisajes de cerros muy frondosos. Verónica o Vero es integrante del grupo “Barrio La Cañada” ella tiene 32 años de edad está casada con el señor Esequiel desde hace cinco años quien trabaja como ingeniero civil juntos han formado una familia con dos niños los cuales asisten al preescolar, Vero tiene una tienda de abarrotes desde hace un año no tiene ningún nombre dice Ella deseaba tener una tienda de abarrotes como la de su papá “Cuando yo vivía con mi papá me gustaba atender  la tienda porque se vendía de todo y además porque tenía mucho  contacto con la gente” platica que inicio con muy poquita mercancía solo productos perecederos como huevo, aceites, sardaninas, atunes, frijoles enlatados,  detergente, etc. no tenia anaqueles tampoco tenía un refrigerador esto no le permitía vender alimentos lácteos como jamón, queso, salchichas, etc. pero con sus ahorros, con las ganancias obtenidas de la venta de sus productos han podido acrecentar su tienda de abarrotes, ahora ya tiene más mercancía, sus anaqueles para sus productos pero también ya tiene su refrigerador ahora si vende todos los productos también puede vender refrescos fríos los cuales se los solicitaban  mucho, esta vez Vero esta solicitando un credito para compar mas mercacia como , pan, huevo, leche, azucar, refrescos etc, su única dificultad es la competencia en su misma comunidad sin embargo Vero no le preocupa porque seguirá trabajando muy duro para lograr tener una tienda igual a la de su papá, la tienda de su papá tiene todo los productos a Vero le hacen falta varias cosas como escobas, mechudos, trapos etc., “Esa es una de mis metas mas grandes lograr tener mercería, para poder mejorar nuestra calidad de vida la de nosotros y también para solventar los gastos de educación de nuestros niños sin preocupaciones”.  Los integrantes del grupo están agradecidos porque el crédito lo emplearán en sus actividades económicas lo que quizás les ayudara a aumentar sus ganancias y ampliar su negocio. Doña Irma, Adriana, Marcelina y María Elsa invertirán en sus tiendas de abarrotes, Rosario y María Juana invertirán en sus borregos, Ma Rosario invertirá en la venta de ropa en general.
texts.en:
The "Barrio La Canada" (La Cañada district) group is made up of eight very hardworking women who all share the same determination to excel in their businesses and support their families. They have known each other for a number of years and during this time they have built up a close and sincere friendship. They live in a Mazahua community where some people still communicate in their native language. Nowadays very few women still wear the typical local dress which is characterized by very bright colors. Something very characteristic of the community where the group is based is its very green pasture land and the beautiful scenery of wooded hills. 

Verónica (also called Vero) is a member of the "Barrio La Cañada” group. She is 32 years old, has been married to Esequiel for five years. He works as a civil engineer. Together they have formed a family with two children who attend preschool. Vero has had a grocery store for the past year, which still does not have a name. She says that she wanted to have a grocery store like her father: "When I lived with my father I liked to tend to the store because it everything was sold there and I had a lot of contact with people." She says that she started with very little merchandise, only perishable products like eggs, oils, sardines, tuna, canned beans, detergents, etc. 

She did not have shelves or a refrigerator either, and this did not allow her to sell products like ham, cheese, sausages, etc. But, with her savings, with the profits obtained from the sale of her products, she has been able to grow her grocery store. Now she has more merchandise, shelves for her products, and also a refrigerator. Now she does sell all of the products and also can sell cold refreshments which people requested a lot. This time Vero is requesting a loan to buy more merchandise like bread, eggs, milk, sugar, soft drinks, etc. 

Her only difficulty is the competition in the same community. However, Vero is not worried because she will continue working very hard in order to have a store just like her father's store. Her father's store has all of the products that Vero is lacking, various things like brooms, mops, dish towels, etc. She says, "This is one of my biggest goals, to have more merchandise, to be able to improve our quality of life, and also to pay for the education costs of our children without worries."

The members of the group are thankful because they will use the loan in their economic activities, which will perhaps help them to improve their profits and expand their business. Irma, Adriana, Marcelina, and María Elsa will invest in their grocery stores, Rosario and María Juana will invest in their sheep, and Ma Rosario will invest in the sale of clothing.

loans.use: to buy milk, bread, eggs, soft drinks, canned goods etc.

location.town: San Jeronimo de los Dolores, San Felipe del Progre

loans.name: Melba

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal Por Un Nuevo Amanecer se reúne cada quince días en Cantón Montecristi, conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla.
En este lugar vive la señora Melba, tiene 55 años de edad, mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene cinco hijos, todos ellos ya mayores de edad, una de ellos aun vive en su casa. Su esposo es albañil.
Doña Melba para poder salir adelante  y ayudarle a su marido con los gastos del hogar  se dedica al comercio, vende ropa de todo tipo, ella aprovecha sus ratos libres y fines de semana que tiene más tiempo, deja su mercadería a crédito y cobra cada quince días, empezó este negocio gracias al primer  crédito que recibió del banco por lo cual está muy agradecida con la institución ya que con esto ella afronta los gastos de la casa cuando su marido no tiene trabajo.
Este crédito es para comprar ropa de todo tipo, lleva dos años  en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque gracias al primer crédito empezó su negocio. Sus sueños son que nunca les falte nada a su familia.
texts.en:
The communal bank "Por Un Nuevo Amanecer" (For a New Dawn) meets every two weeks in Montecristi Canton.  The area is known for its rich pre-colonial culture and its handicrafts, which receive national as well as international recognition.  It is also the place to find famous straw hats. 
Here we meet señora Melba, who is 55-years old and had five children with her partner.  All of her children are grown, and one of them still lives at home.  Doña Melba's husband is a bricklayer. 
In order to get ahead and help her husband with the household expenses, doña Melba earns money selling all types of clothing.  She takes advantage of her free time and the weekends, when she has more time, to make her sales.  She sells her merchandise on credit and collects payments every two weeks.  She started this business with the first loan she received from the communal bank, for which she is very grateful to the institution.  With her business, Doña Melba is able to take care of the household expenses when her husband doesn't have work.  
This loan is for the purchase of all types of clothing.  Doña Melba has been with her communal bank for two years.  She likes it because thanks to the first loan she received, she was able to start her business.  Her dream is that her family never lack a thing.

loans.use: to purchase clothing.

loans.name: Rosa Ramona Asuncion

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal Por Un Nuevo Amanecer se reúne cada quince días en Cantón Montecristi, conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla.
En este lugar vive la señora Rosa, tiene 53 años de edad, mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene cinco hijos, todos ellos ya mayores de edad e independientes. Su esposo no trabaja por motivos de enfermedad.
Doña Rosa es una mujer muy luchadora que siempre le gusto valerse por sí misma y obtener sus propios ingresos gracias a su trabajo, ella tiene un negocio de venta de comida, prepara almuerzos y meriendas en su casa los mismos que luego manda a entregar en una camioneta por toda la ciudad donde le realizan los encargos, con ella trabaja una persona que es la encargada de realizar las entregas y a la cual le paga por este servicio, a diario tiene que entregar 70 almuerzos y 30 meriendas, ella lleva 25 años dedicada a esta actividad razón por lo cual tiene mucha clientela además por lo delicioso que ella prepara la comida.
Este crédito es para comprar arroz, carne, pescado y otros víveres para preparar los alimentos, lleva más de 10 años en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque los créditos son de mucha ayuda para ella. Sus sueños son seguir adelante en su negocio.
texts.en:
El Banco Comunal Por Un Nuevo Amanecer  (The Community Bank for a New Dawn) meets every 15 days in Cantón Montecristi, which is known for its rich pre-colonial culture and handicrafts that are recognized on a national and international level. The home of the famous Panama hats.

Here, 53 year old Rosa lives, she has a common-law relationship from which she has five children, who are all older and independent . 
Her husband does not work due to illness .

Dona Rosa is a very feisty woman who has always chose to fend for herself and make her own income from her work.
She has a business selling food, preparing lunches and snacks at home which she then sends them to be delivered by a truck around town where they deliver the orders. 

She works with one person who is responsible for making the deliveries and whom she pays for this service.
On a daily basis she must complete 70 lunches and 30 snacks. She has spent 25 years dedicated to this activity, this is why she has so many customers, in addition to the fact that the food she prepares is delicious.

This loan is to buy rice, meat, fish and other ingredients to prepare the food. She has over 10 years with the community bank and likes it because the loans are very helpful for her. Her dream is to  move forward in her business.

loans.use: to buy rice, meat, fish and other food.

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
As the married mother of five children, Lolita works hard to support her family.

She has a mat making business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from clothing sales. Lolita is borrowing PHP 5,000 through NWTF in order to buy materials needed for her mat weaving.

She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy materials needed for her mat weaving.

loans.name: Ma. Joralyn

texts.en:
Ma. Joralyn is 42 years old and married with one kid.

Ma. Joralyn works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines, and requested a PHP 8,000 loan through NWTF to purchase an additional stock of groceries to sell.

Ma. Joralyn has borrowed and repaid two loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for nine years, and also earns an income from pig fattening.

Ma. Joralyn aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase an additional stock of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Julesia

texts.en:
Julesia is 41 years old and married with six children.

She earns a living by raising livestock in the Philippines. Julesia is borrowing PHP 16,000 through NWTF to purchase vaccines, vitamins, and other supplies for her business.

Julesia has been raising livestock for ten years, and also earns additional income from a general store.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase vaccines, vitamins, and other supplies for her business.

loans.name: Violeta

texts.en:
Violeta is married, and is operating a sari-sari store to earn a living. She has been in this business for six years, and earns 10,000 PHP every month.

She joined GDMPC in 2008, and her previous loan, used for inventory capital, was successfully repaid. 

Recently, she took a loan to purchase rice and feed to sell, in addition to her stock. 

In the future, Violeta will use her income to support her two kids with their daily needs, and also in their studies, until they finish college.  

Violeta wishes that her business would be more progressive.

loans.use: to purchase rice and feed to sell.

loans.name: Davlatoy

texts.ru: Давлатой 28 лет. Она уроженка района Хамадони. Давлатой живет с мужем и двумя дочками, которым по 3 и 1 год. Давлатой во дворе своего дома разводит крупнорогатый скот. Этим делом она занимается в течение 10 лет. Ей помогает ее муж.  Ее муж владеет 3 гектаром земли, на котором он работает и трудится неустанно, но находит время, чтобы помочь своей жене. Сейчас Давлатой запрашивает кредит, чтобы закупить пару голов молодых бычков для увеличения поголовья скота в своем скотном дворе.
texts.en: Davlatoy is 28 years old.  She is a native of the Hamadoni district of Tajikistan.  She lives with her husband and her two young daughters, ages 3 and 1.  She raises cattle at home and has been involved in this activity for the past ten years.  Her husband helps her to run the business.  He owns three hectares of land on which he works tirelessly, but he still finds the time to help his wife.  Davlatoy is taking a loan to buy a couple of young bulls for cattle breeding.

loans.use: to buy a couple of bulls for cattle breeding.

loans.name: Mary Jean

texts.en:
This is Mary Jean, 27, a resident of Payatas, Philippines. She is married to Restituto, and they have children. Together with her husband, she manages their household while operating the business.  At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.
  
Mary Jean operates a piggery. She earns an income by selling live hogs to meat dealers. Sometimes they have the pigs slaughtered and sold in the market.  Aside from this, she also cooks breakfast meals for additional income. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of Php 1,200 in sales every week.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php10,000 loan. She will use the loan to buy feed and additional hogs. 

Mary Jean dreams that her business will grow bigger, and hopes to have their own lot and house. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week, and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.
 
* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for feed and additional hogs needed in her business.

loans.name: Jessica Maribel

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal Por Un Nuevo Amanecer se reúne cada quince días en Cantón Montecristi, conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla.
En este lugar vive la señora Jessica, tiene 28 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen dos hijos de 7 y 5  años de edad, ambos estudian en escuela. Su esposo es obrero. 
Doña Jessica es una muy buena madre y esposa que para ayudar con los gastos del hogar se dedica al comercio, vende ropa de todo tipo y su forma de ventas es puerta a puerta, sale a recorrer  con su mercadería más que todo en las mañanas ya que a esa hora sus hijos está en la escuela y puede salir sin ningún problema, ella deja su mercadería a crédito y cobra cada quince días, lleva más de 6 años en este negocio con el cual gana lo necesario para el estudio de sus pequeños.
Este crédito es para comprar pantalones, blusas y otras prendas que ella vende, lleva 3 años en el Banco Comunal y le gusta por la ayuda que le brindan los créditos. Sus sueños son darles lo mejor a sus hijos.
texts.en:
The communal bank "Por Un Nuevo Amanecer" (For a New Dawn) meets every two weeks in Montecristi Canton.  The area is known for its rich pre-colonial culture and its handicrafts, which have gained national and international recognition.  It is also the place to find the famous straw hats.  
This is where señora Jessica, who is 28-years old, lives.  She is married, and she and her husband have two children, who are 7 and 5-years old respectively.  Both children go to school.  Doña Jessica's husband is a laborer.  
Doña Jessica is a very good mother and wife.  To help with the household expenses, she sells all types of clothing.  She sells door-to-door and usually goes out to make her sales in the mornings.  The mornings are easier because her children are in school.  Doña Jessica leaves her merchandise on credit and collects payments every two weeks.  She has been in this business for more than six years, and with it she earns enough to pay for her little ones' education. 
This loan is for the purchase of pants, blouses and other garments that doña Jessica sells.  She has been with the communal bank for three years, and she likes it for the help from the loans.  Doña Jessica's dream is to give her children the best.

loans.use: to purchase pants, blouses and other garments.

loans.name: Marjorie

texts.en:
Marjorie works hard to support her family; she is married, and has a buy and sell banana business in the Philippines.  She has been in this business for 4 years.

Marjorie requested a PHP 17,000 loan through NWTF to buy more bananas to sell.

She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more bananas to sell

loans.name: Floresa

texts.en:
Floresa is 43 years old, married and lives in East Pob. Manukan, Zamboanga del Norte, Philippines. With a desire to earn more, she decided to raise pigs to sell.

Through Paglaum PC she obtained the capital to purchase piglets and feed. Now she is requesting a loan of 14,900 PHP to buy additional piglets and feed. She really hopes and prays that her business will grow and benefit her family, in addition to the income of her husband. Someday, she wants to build a concrete pig cage to easily keep them in more sanitary conditions.

loans.use: to buy piglets and feed.

loans.name: Serikbol

texts.en:
Mr.Serikbol is 40 years old, and lives with his wife and four children in a house in the Bayan-Ulgii province, Mongolia. His wife Saltanat is currently unemployed. His older two children are university students, and younger two children are high school students.

Serikbol has been providing a taxi service business in town for years. He is a reliable and careful driver, and also is known among the residents with his quality service. He has been driving his old car for years, and now it needs to be replaced to provide his taxi service to his clients. 

He is requesting a loan of 2,500,000 MNT to purchase a better car to provide his taxi service business. He is a hardworking and helpful man.

loans.use: to purchase a better car for his taxi service business

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria is a widow with five children.  She is 67 years old, and lives in Alegria, Lopez Jaena, Misamis Occidental Philippines.

Maria has a rice farm to earn a living; she has been doing this for 30 years. Maria has been a member of PMPC for seven years.

She has requested a loan to purchase farm inputs, like fertilizer and pesticide.

In the future, Maria hopes to have enough savings for her family's future.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and pesticides.

loans.name: Journalyn

texts.en:
Journalyn, 34, is a married woman with two children who are in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. 

Journalyn has a general store business in the Philippines; she has been in this business for three years. 

She requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to buy more items like candies, biscuits, soft drinks, juice, snack foods, etc. to sell.

Journalyn would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more items like candies, biscuits, soft drinks, juice, snack foods, etc. to sell

loans.name: Mariafe

texts.en:
Mariafe is 39 years old and lives in Alegria, Lopez Jaena, Misamis Occidental. She is married with four children.
 
Mariafe has a pig raising business and earns approximately PHP 4,000 each month doing this type of work. She has requested a loan to purchase feed and vitamins.
. 
Mariafe has been a member of PMPC for four years. In the future, Mariafe hopes to have more savings for her children's education.

loans.use: to purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
This is Marilyn, 55, a resident of Payatas, Quezon City, Philippines. She is married to Efren, a vendor, and they have children. She and her husband manage their household while operating the business. She is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Marilyn operates a variety store.  In the Philippines, a variety store is a retail store that sells inexpensive items, often with a single price for all items in the store. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a Php 5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of Php 500 in sales every day.

She is requesting a Php 10,000 loan to help her continue in the operation of her business. She will use the loan to buy groceries, toiletries, and beverages to expand her product inventory.

Marilyn dreams that her business will continue to grow and hopes that her child will finish his studies.  She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week, and draws strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries, and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Beverly

texts.en:
Beverly works hard to support her family. She is married and has a buy and sell dry goods business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for seven years.

Beverly requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy an additional stock of dry goods like blouses, shorts, pants, dress, etc. to sell.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more stock of dry goods like blouses, shorts, pants, dress, etc. to sell

loans.name: Jose Nelson

texts.es:
José, está ampliando su negocio y necesita capital para invertir en compra de arroz, frijol, aceite, consomé, etc., con el crédito amplió su negocio vario los productos que ofrecía a sus clientes, mejoro su condición familiar, ha cancelado sus deudas y tiene muchos clientes nuevos.
Sigue apoyando en los gastos de su casa y trabajando por tener un negocio más rentable que le de las utilidades que el necesita.
texts.en: Jose is expanding his business and needs capital to invest in the purchase of rice, beans, oil, consommé, etc. With his previous loan, he expanded his business and increased the assortment of products he offered to his customers. He improved his family's conditions, paid his debts and won many new customers. He continues supporting the household expenses and working to have a more profitable business which provides him the earnings that he requires.

loans.use: to buy rice, beans, oil, and consommé

loans.name: Ashurhon

texts.ru: Ашурхону 38 лет. Она трудолюбивая и целеустремленная женщина. Ашурхон 5 лет назад вместе со своими сестрами открыла салон красоты. Ее салон красоты находится в центре ее района. Она 2 года назад привезла свадебные платья и начала дать на прокат свадебные платья. Муж Ашурхона является трудовым мигрантом в Российской Федерации. Два месяца назад она поехала к мужу в Россию. Она оттуда привезла свадебные платья и обновила свой ассортимент. Ашурхон должна провести свадьбу своей дочери. Она не имеет достаточно денег. Она нуждается в деньгах, так как по таджикским обычаям проведение свадебного торжества требует много денег. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 6000 сомони для проведения свадебного торжества своей дочери. Она ждет вашу доброту и надеется на ваше милосердие.
texts.en:
Ashurhon is 38 years old.  She is a hardworking and goal-oriented woman.  Five years ago, she and her sisters opened a beauty salon in the center of their district.  Two years ago, she brought in wedding dresses and started to rent them out.

Ashurhon's husband is a migrant worker who currently lives in Russia.  Ashurhon visited him two months ago and brought back some wedding dresses to renew her inventory.

Ashurhon now needs to organize her daughter's wedding, but she doesn't have enough money to do so.
