Traditionally, wedding ceremonies are very costly events in Tajikistan, and this is why Ashurhon needs money.  She is taking a loan of 6,000 somoni to pay for her daughter's wedding ceremony.  She is relying on your kindness and generosity.

loans.use: to pay for her daughter's wedding celebration.

loans.name: Marlene

texts.en:
This is Marlene, 32, a resident of Payatas, Philippines. She is married to Ferdinand, her business partner, and she a mother to her children. She, together with her husband, manages the household while operating a business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.
  
Marlene operates a junk shop. Trash is not actively segregated in the Philippines, and while waiting for their local dump trucks, people scavenge garbage dumps and trash bags for recyclable materials like metal, copper, plastic, paper and other materials. They sell these to junk shops for a little profit. Junk shops then stack, clean, and gather huge quantities of these materials and sell them back to foundries like factories and others of the like. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of PHP 1,000 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 8,000 loan. She will be incorporating the loan into her current revolving fund used to buy recyclable materials from collectors. 

Marlene dreams that her business will flourish and hopes that her children will finish their studies. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her life and business every week and draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies. 

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for recyclable materials needed in her business.

loans.name: Relly

texts.en:
Relly is 43 years old, married and a mother with three children who are all in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Relly has a mat-making business in the Philippines. Relly requested a PHP 9,000 loan through NWTF to buy raw materials for her mats.

Relly has been in this business for 12 years. In the future, Relly would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy raw materials to weave mats

loans.name: Rosenda

texts.en:
Rosenda is 30 years old and lives in Colambutan Settlement, Tudela, Philippines. She is single with two children.
 
To earn a living, Rosenda has a business selling fruits in the local market. She earns about PHP 3,500 each month doing this type of work. Rosenda has requested a loan to buy additional fruits to sell such as banana and melon.

Rosenda has been a member of PMPC for three years.  In the future, Rosenda would like to save for her children's school fees.

loans.use: to buy additional fruits to sell such as banana and melon

loans.name: Angelina

texts.en:
Angelina is 75 years old and married with five children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Angelina runs a general store in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 13 years and sells a variety of items, such as canned goods, toothpaste, detergent, soft drinks, biscuits and other groceries.  

Angelina has requested a 14,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy more goods to sell in her general store. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more goods to sell in her general store, such as canned goods, toothpaste, detergent, soft drinks, biscuits and other groceries

loans.name: Adela

texts.en:
Adela is 43 years old and married with two children who are currently in school.  Adela works very hard to provide for them.

Adela runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy more goods to sell in her general store.

Adela has been in this business for six years and sells a variety of items such as canned goods, soft drinks, fabric conditioner, shampoo, detergent soap and other groceries. 

Adela would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more goods to sell in her general store

loans.name: Rosalita

texts.en: Rosalita is helping her husband manage their own farm for a living. She has two children living with their own families near her home. She joined Gata Daku Multi-purpose Cooperative (GDMPC) to access the services offered and took out a loan to buy fertilizer for her farm. She is hopeful to have more revenue from the farm and to be able to use it for their daily needs. Rosalita plans to save money for the future emergencies of the entire family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her farm

loans.name: Mercedita

texts.en:
Mercedita is 49 years old and lives in Balanlinao, Plaridel, Misamis Occidental. She is married with two children. 

Mercedita has a business in which she buys and sells pigs, and she earns approximately 4,500 PHP each month doing this type of work. She has  requested a loan to buy piglets, feed and vitamins.

Mercedita has been a member of PMPC for eight years. In the future, she hopes to buy a motorcycle for transportation to earn additional income for her family.

loans.use: to buy piglets, feed and vitamins.

loans.name: Nilda

texts.en:
Nilda is 39 years old and lives in Cartagena Proper, Plaridel, Misamis Occidental. She is married with three children. 

Nilda runs a mini grocery store for a living. She has had this business for five years. She has requested a loan to purchase additional inventory for her store.

Nilda has been a member of PMPC for one year. In the future, she hopes to have more savings for her children's education.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory for her mini grocery store.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah is a 58-year-old member of Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) from Olingan, Dipolog City, Zamboanga del Norte. She is industriously caring for her fishing business. Sarah is married and has eight children. She personally takes charge of the business and her children work for them as support. The business is doing well. Sarah has humbly taught her children how to enjoy the business and at the same time make earnings from it. The ups and downs of the business are nothing but a normal situation for her. Sometimes they have business losses; sometimes a good return. She is a savvy businesswoman.

Now Sarah sees a good opportunity to expand their business. She is requesting a 37,000 Philippine peso loan from PMPC for capital to buy a fishing boat. She deeply wishes for a good education for her kids and for them to have businesses of their own.

loans.use: to buy a fishing boat.

loans.name: Josie

texts.en:
This is Josie, 46, a resident of Payatas, Quezon CIty, Philippines. She is married to Wilfredo and they have children. She and her husband and children manage their own household while operating a business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.

Josie makes foam beds to earn money. She buys raw materials and then makes  foam beds of different sizes. Her finished products are distributed to markets, general stores and other places where she has contacts for her products. She earns a small margin for every foam bed that she delivers. She earns a minimum of PHP 3,000 weekly.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 26,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy materials like cloth, plastic, foam and other materials needed to make the foam beds.

Josie hopes that her business will continue to expand and dreams of being able to give her children a good life and an education. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and to also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for materials needed in a foam bed like cloth, plastic, foam and other materials.

loans.name: Marina

texts.en:
Marina is 65 years old, separated, and a resident of Olinagn, Dipolog City, Zamboanga del Norte. She earns a living through ice selling. She has been a member of PMPC for seven years and enjoys the privileges being a member of the Cooperative. 

Now, she is requesting a loan of PHP 4,000.00 to purchase a freezer. Marina deeply wishes to maintain in good standing with PMPC.

loans.use: to purchase a freezer for ice vending.

loans.name: Marife

texts.en:
Marife has been operating her general store for over 20 years.She is married and blessed with three grown-up children. She and her husband both work hard in order to generate income to live on.

With her goal of increasing her income, she is asking for a loan of PHP 28,000 which will allow her to purchase grocery items such as soft drinks, canned goods, and biscuits. She knows that having this additional capital will enable her to strengthen her general store, satisfy her customers' demands, and obtain a better income, which will be used for daily consumption and saving for emergency purposes.

loans.use: to buy grocery items such as soft drinks, canned goods, and biscuits for her general store

loans.name: Bessie

texts.en:
Bessie aims to have a stable source of income since she's getting old already. She is 60 years old, married, and blessed with five children. Four of her children have settled down in marriage while the one left still attends school. Bessie's husband is a farmer within their local community. Aside from the retail store business, Bessie also owns 1.5 hectares of rice field and a motorcycle transport.

Bessie would like to take out a loan of PHP 8,000 which will be used to purchase grocery items such as soft drinks, ingredients, and canned goods for her retail store. She hopes that lenders will grant her requested loan amount so she can keep her business productive and profitable.

loans.use: to buy grocery items such as soft drinks, ingredients, and canned goods for her retail store

loans.name: Catalina

texts.en:
Catalina is 60 years old and widowed with eight children. Catalina works very hard to provide for them.

Catalina runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to buy more stock to sell.

Catalina has been in this business for two years and sells a variety of items such as dried fish, canned goods, shampoo, hair conditioner, laundry soap, etc. 

Catalina would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell

loans.name: Mastura

texts.ru: Мастура кредитуется в ИМОНе 7 раз. Мастура порядочная и добрая женщина. Ей 40 лет. Она более 7 лет работает в государственном учреждении. Она имеет дополнительный доход от скотоводства. Она откармливает скот у себя дома. Мастуре помогают ее дети по откармливанию скота. Она имеет 2 детей. Мастура замужем. Ее муж работает учителем в средней школе. Он имеет маленькую зарплату. Поэтому Мастура является основной кормилицей семьи. Мастура и ее муж уже давно мечтают отремонтировать свой дом. Однако они не имеют достаточно денег. Мастура запрашивает займ на сумму 3500 сомони для покупки как цемент, древесина и т.п. Она ждет вашу доброту и надеется на ваше милосердие.
texts.en:
This is the seventh time that Mastura, age 40, is taking a loan from IMON International.  She is an honest and kind woman who has been working for a public institution for seven years.  In addition, she makes an income from animal husbandry, fattening livestock at home with the help of her children.  

Mastura is married and the mother of two children.  Her husband works as a teacher in a secondary school and earns a small salary.  For this reason, Mastura is the family's main breadwinner.

Mastura and her husband have dreamed about repairing their house for a long time.  However, they don't have enough money to do so.  Mastura is taking a loan of 3,500 somoni to buy cement, wood and so forth.  She is relying on your kindness and generosity.

loans.use: to buy cement and wood to repair her house.

loans.name: Tranquilino

texts.en:
Tranquilino cultivates 8,200 square meters of rice fields and three hectares of corn farm, and is also engaged in a livestock business. He has been managing his farming for five years, while spending six years on his livestock business. Tranquilino lives with his live-in partner and her two children. 

Tranquilino is a hardworking and responsible man. Though he is not the real father of his partner's children, he still does everything in order to send them to school. Since he has bigger responsibilities now, he decided to borrow additional capital in the amount of 25,000 Philippines pesos (PHP). 

He will use this loan to buy livestock feed and medicine to make his hogs healthy upon reaching their optimum growth. He hopes for approval of his requested loan amount so he can maintain his farming and livestock business.

loans.use: to purchase livestock feed and medicine for his hogs.

loans.name: Maricel

texts.en:
As a married mother of five children, Maricel works hard to support her family.

She has a fish vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from vegetable vending.  Maricel is borrowing 9,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) through NWTF in order to buy more fish to sell in her food stall.

Maricel has been sustaining her business activities through her past two loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell in her food stall.

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
Marilou is 34 years old. She is a married mother with five children. Three of her children are in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Marilou has a business as massage therapist in the Philippines. Marilou requested a 7,000 PHP loan amount through NWTF to purchase hot oil, body lotion, and other personal products for her massage therapy business.

Marilou has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, Marilou would like to save money so she can continue to send her children to college and improve her house.

loans.use: to purchase hot oil, body lotion, and other personal products for her massage therapy business.

loans.name: Santos Salvador

texts.es:
Santos, está necesitando capital para invertir en la siembra de cultivo de maíz y frijol. Comprara semilla, fertilizantes, abonos, y pagara gente para preparar la tierra. Con el crédito anterior el tuvo una cosecha más abundante, mejoro sus ingresos y amplio el área de siembra.
Santos tiene el propósito de que a través de su cultivo  dar a su familia mejores condiciones de vida, mejor alimentación, educación y salud.
texts.en:
Santos is in need of capital to invest in planting his crops of corn and beans. He will buy seeds, fertilizer, and compost, and he will pay people to prepare the land. With the previous loan, he had a more abundant harvest, improved his earnings, and expanded his planting area. 

Santos’s objective is through his farming, to give his family better living conditions, food, education, and health.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizer, and compost, and to pay workers.

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
This is Helen. She previously accessed a 25,000 PHP loan that she used to buy more silver and gold accessories needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help in their personal, household, and business expenditures.
 
She would like to apply for another 25,000 PHP loan for her to buy additional stocks of silver and gold accessories needed in her business. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from business will definitely help her to sustain her family's daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Helen hopes that her business will last longer and have more customers. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week where she finds strength and encouragement studying the word of God.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15-30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for more silver and gold accessories needed in her business.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en: Evelyn, 40 years of age, is married to a farmer, and they are blessed with three children. Evelyn is in the retailing business, particularly selling grocery items. Her store is inside the school campus so she also sells school supplies for additional income. She's been in this business for almost 20 years and earns a net income of 600 PHP a day. They spend this profit on the school allowances of their children, food allowances, and electric bills. Due to lack of capital she would like to request a loan of 25,000 PHP to purchase breads, canned goods, sugar, coffee, creamer, and beverages to sell. She's hoping that her business will continue to grow and become more progressive.

loans.use: To purchase breads, canned goods, sugar, coffee, creamer, and beverages to sell

loans.name: Sakobat

texts.ru: Сакобат уже давно была студенткой Медицинского института. Она училась успешно и всегда мечтала стать хорошим педиатром. Ее мечта сбылась. Она более 20 лет работает педиатром в больнице своего района. Она честно выполняет свою работу и довольна, что выбрала эту профессию. Сакобат замужем и на воспитании имеет 4 детей. Она всегда выделяла огромное внимание образованию своих детей. Сабокат хочет улучшить условию проживания. Она вместе семьей живет в старом доме. Она планирует отремонтировать свой дом. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 10000 сомони для покупки строительных материалов как цемент, краски, древесина и т.п. Она надеется на ваше милосердие.
texts.en:
Many years ago, when still in medical school, Sakobat was an excellent student who dreamed about becoming a good pediatrician.  Her dream came true, and for the past 20 years now she has been working as a pediatrician at a local hospital.  She fulfills her duties with professionalism, and she is happy with the career that she chose.

Sakobat is also married and raising four children.  Her children's education has always been a priority in her life.  At the same time she wants to improve their living conditions.  Sakobat's  family lives in an old house which she is planning to repair.  She is taking a loan of 10,000 somoni to buy building materials such as cement, paints, wood and so forth.  She is relying on your generosity.

loans.use: to buy building materials as cement, paint and wood to repair her house.

loans.name: Redalyn

texts.en:
As a married mother of seven children, Redalyn works hard to support her family.

She has a massage therapy business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from a general store.  Redalyn is borrowing 7,000 PHP through NWTF in order to purchase body lotion and hot oil to use for her massage business.

She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase body lotion and hot oil to use for massage.

loans.name: Celsa

texts.en:
Celsa is a married mother with four children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Celsa is 56 years old and all of her children are in school.

Celsa has a massage therapist business in the Philippines. She requested a loan of 6,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) through NWTF to purchase body lotion and hot oil to use for massage.

Celsa has been in this business for 20 years. In the future, Celsa would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase body lotion and hot oil to use for massage.

loans.name: Tatu

texts.en:
Tatu is married and a mother of three children who attend school. She owns a house that has no electricity or piped water.

She sells fruits and green vegetables, and she always struggles to improve her grocery stall, trying to sell more and save money in order to have a more formal establishment. She is requesting a loan to buy sacks of fruits and green vegetables for resale.

loans.use: to buy sacks of fruits and green vegetables for resale.

loans.name: Geovanni Aristides

texts.es:
Geovanni, opta por invertir más en su tienda, comprara productos de la canasta básica (arroz, azúcar, frijol, etc.), para mantenerla bien surtida y que sus clientes encuentren lo que están buscando, con el préstamo anterior el amplio su negocio, mejoro sus condiciones económicas lo que le permitió cancelar las cuotas del crédito y cubrir los gastos de sus estudios universitarios.
Él tiene un miembro más en su familia, están saludables y siguen luchando por salir adelante.
texts.en: Geovanni chose to invest more in his store. He will buy staples (rice, sugar, beans, etc.) in order to keep it well stocked, so that his clients can find what they are looking for. With the previous loan he expanded his business, and he improved his economic conditions, which allowed him to repay credit fees and cover the cost of his university studies. He has another member in his family. They are healthy and continue to fight to get ahead.

loans.use: To buy rice, sugar and beans

loans.name: Marizon

texts.en: Transportation has been Marizon's business for more than four years. She is glad because her husband is supportive in running their motorcycle transport business. In order to maintain her transportation business, Marizon is requesting a loan of 8,000 PHP to buy paint which will be used to re-paint her motorcycle side car. She hopes that through her hard work and additional capital, she will be able to maintain the safety of her passengers.

loans.use: to buy paint for her motorcycle sidecar.

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita is very thankful for the financial assistance extended to her. She was able to buy additional hogs and feeds for her business, which has been running for 10 years now. Her loan was also helpful in the education of her children. Her income from the business assisted in their everyday household expenditures. She and her husband are working hard to provide for their everyday needs.

She would like to apply for a new 40,000 PHP [Philippines pesos] loan for her to buy additional hogs and feeds needed for her business. Her profits from the business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs and the educational expenses of her children. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Lolita hopes that her business will continue to grow and dreams to have a better living. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for feeds and additional hogs needed in her business.

loans.name: Rosalie

texts.en:
As a married mother of 11 children, Rosalie works hard to support her family.

She has a massage-therapist business in the Philippines. Rosalie is borrowing 7,000 PHP [Philippines pesos] through NWTF to buy towels, bedsheets, body lotion and hot oil for her massage-therapist business.

She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money so she can continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy towels, bedsheets, body lotion and hot oil for her massage-therapist business.

loans.name: Asha

texts.en:
Asha has operated a business of selling goats, chickens and potatoes to earn a living. In addition to this, she also sells clothes to supplement her income. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. 

With the loan she is requesting, she wants to purchase one sack of potatoes, oil to fry chicken and five chicks for her business. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business, and she appreciates the support given.

loans.use: to purchase one sack of potatoes, oil to fry chicken and five chicks.

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en:
Imelda is 45 years old and married with two children, one of whom is in school. Imelda works very hard to provide for them.

Imelda runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 5,000 PHP [Philippines pesos] loan through NWTF to purchase additional groceries to sell.

Imelda has been in this business for three years and sells a variety of items such as soap, shampoo, sardines and other groceries. 

In the future, Imelda would like to save enough to support the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional groceries to sell.

loans.name: Bidalla

texts.en:
Bidalla is married with two children who attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. 

She operates an open-air food business, selling dumplings and flatbread to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business.  Her dream is to establish a cafe business in the near future. 

With the 20,000 Kenyan shillings, she wants to purchase stock of wheat flour, sugar, and cooking oil for the business. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase stock of wheat flour, sugar, and cooking oil for the business.

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en:
Lilia is 44 years old and a married mother with eight children. Six of her children are in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Lilia has a massage therapy business in the Philippines. Lilia requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to purchase towels, bed sheets, hot oil and body lotion.

Lilia has been in this business for fourteen years. In the future, Lilia would like to save money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase towels, bed sheets, hot oil and body lotion.

loans.name: Julieta

texts.en:
Julieta is a 38 year old married woman with five children, 4 of them are in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Julieta has a computer gaming business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 20,000 loan amount through NWTF to pay for the internet bills, electricity and purchase additional units for her business.

Julieta has been in this business for 2 years and would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to pay for internet bills, electricity and purchase additional units for her business

loans.name: Luisa María

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal Por Un Nuevo Amanecer se reúne cada quince días en Cantón Montecristi, conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla.
En este lugar vive la señora Luisa, tiene 67 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen tres hijos los mismos que ya son mayores de edad, una de sus hijos  aún vive con ella junto con su esposo y dos nietos. Su esposo es albañil.
Doña Luisa al ver que en ocasiones su marido no tiene trabajo hace más de cinco años empezó un pequeño negocio en su casa, ella vende helados jugos y bebidas de toda clase, su casa está muy cerca de una cancha lugar donde todos los días llegan muchas personas a hacer deporte por lo cual sus ventas son muy buenas.  Gracias a esto en ciertas ocasiones que su marido está sin trabajo es como salen adelante. 
Este crédito es para surtir aún más su negocio, va a comprar jugos, helados, colas, etc. Esta casi desde el inicio en el  Banco Comunal y le gusta por los beneficios y ayuda que le brinda la institución. Sus sueños son seguir adelante y gozar de buena salud.
texts.en:
The communal bank “Por Un Nuevo Amanecer” (For a New Dawn) meets every fifteen days in Montecristi Canton, known for its rich pre-colonial culture and its handicrafts, which are recognized at a national and international level. It is the home of the famous Panama hats. 

In this place lives Luisa. She is 67 years old and is married. From this relationship, she has three children who are grown. One of her children still lives with her, along with her spouse and two grandchildren. Luisa’s husband is a mason. 

After seeing that sometimes, her husband doesn’t have work, more than five years ago Luisa opened a small business in her house. She sells ice cream, juice and all kinds of drinks. Her house is very close to a field where every day, many people come to play sports; because of this, her sales are excellent. Thanks to this, at certain times when her husband is out of work, she is able to continue forward. 

This loan is for stocking her business even more. She is going to buy juice, ice cream, cola, etc. She has been in the communal bank almost from the beginning, and she likes it for the benefits and help that the organization offers to her. Her dreams are to get ahead and to enjoy good health.

loans.use: to purchase juice, ice cream, cola, etc.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en: Joseph is aged 38 and is married with 6 children between the ages of 7 and 16.  They all live in Kagadi, Uganda. He deals in agricultural produce sales and he started the business in order to raise money to meet his family's daily expenses. He is also involved in alcohol brewing and animal rearing.  Like most traders in this kind of business, he is affected by the high cost of transport and price fluctuations. His dream is to set up a food store in town. Joseph intends to use the loan to buy beans, maize and ground nuts to sell.

loans.use: to purchase beans, maize and ground nuts to sell.

loans.name: George

texts.en:
George is 29 years old and is married to Hellen. They have been blessed with two children. He has a metal workshop in Tala town where he makes metal door frames as well as window frames. He has been in the business for 5 years. Besides the metal workshop business, he also sells timber.  

He will be using the loan to purchase a power saw. This will enable him make more timber and wood chips to sell as firewood.

This is his 6th loan term and he paid all his previous loans successfully. His hopes and dreams are to be financially stable.

loans.use: To buy a power saw for his business.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en: Erlinda is 52 years old and married with six children. To make a living, Erlinda owns and operates a specialized general store and  has been  in her business for six years .In 2007, Erlinda joined GDMPC and her previous that was used to purchased goods was successfully repaid. She is requesting a new loan to purchase new items such as rice and feed to sell. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase new items such as rice and feed to sell

loans.name: Bunusa

texts.ru: Бунусе 60 лет, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают 2 детей. У Бунусы - высшее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи Бунуса занимается животноводством, стартовав 10 лет назад, с покупки скота на 10,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Бунусы, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 2 дойные коровы, а также имеет земельный надел размером 0,74 ГА, на которой она ежегодно выращивает: кукурузу, пшеницу. Ежемесячный доход составляет 17,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Бунуса обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку коров для откорма и дальнейшей перепродажи. Доходы от кредита Бунуса планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, и планирует накопить средства на ремонт сарая.
texts.en: Bunusa is 60 years old, married and raising two children together with her husband. Bunusa has a higher education. To provide the primary income for her family, Bunusa is involved in animal husbandry, having started 10 years ago with a purchase of livestock with 10,000 som (KGS). Thanks to Bunusa's hard work, today her business contains 2 dairy cows and also a 0.74 hectare land plot, where she annually grows corn and wheat. The monthly income amounts to 17,000 som (KGS). In order to further develop her business, Bunusa requested a loan in the amount of 50,000 som (KGS) from the microfinance bank "Bai-Tushum and Partners" to buy cows for fattening up and subsequent resale. Bunusa plans to invest the earnings from the loan into further increasing domestic livestock quantities and saving money to repair a barn.

loans.use: to buy cows for fattening up and subsequent resale

loans.name: Shohidakhon

texts.ru: Шохидахон молодая и не счастливая женщина. Она вышла замуж в марте этого года и развелась с мужем в июне. Она живет с родителями и братьями. Шохидахон с 2011 года училась у портнихи шитью женской одежды и данное время она умело и красиво шьёт женские платья. Шохидахон благодаря хорошему сервису имеет своих клиентов. Она имеет доброе сердце. Ее тётя попросила помочь ей. Ее тётя не имеет постоянное место работы в Таджикистане и поэтому хочет уехать в Российскую Федерацию. Шохидахон запрашивает займ на сумму 2000 сомони для покупки авиабилета. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Shohidakhon is a young and unlucky woman.  She got married in March of this year and got divorced from her husband in June.  She lives with her parents and brothers.  Shohidakhon has been learning to sew women's clothing from a seamstress since 2011 and currently sews women's dresses skillfully and beautifully.  Shohidakhon has her own customers thanks to her good service.  She has a kind heart.  Her aunt asked Shohidakhon to help her.  Her aunt does not have a permanent place of employment in Tajikistan and this is why wants to go to the Russian Federation.  Shohidakhon is requesting a loan in the amount of 2000 somoni to purchase an airline ticket for her.  She awaits your kindness.

loans.use: to buy an airline ticket for her aunt to go to Russia

loans.name: Tahmina

texts.ru: Тахмина современная женщина, которая родилась в 1981 года. Она замужем и на воспитании имеет 3 не совершеннолетних детей. Тахмина с детства училась у портнихи шитью женской одежды. Тахмина уже опытная портниха. Она более 7 лет занимается предоставлением услуги швеи. Она предоставляет свои услуги дома. Тахмина старается создать хорошею условию проживания для своих детей. Ее муж трудовой мигрант в Российской Федерации. Он отправляет деньги, но его деньги едва хватает для покупки продуктов питания. Тахмина хочет, чтобы ее дети имели компьютер и жили в доме, где имеет мягкую мебель. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 5000 сомони для покупки компьютера и мебели. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en:
Tahmina is a modern woman, who was born in 1981. She is married and is raising three children. As a child Tahmina was taught by a dressmaker how to make women's clothes. Tahmina is now an experienced dressmaker. She has been working as a seamstress for over 7 years. She works from home and tries to create good living conditions for her children. 

Her husband is a migrant worker in the Russian Federation. He sends money home but that money hardly covers the cost of food for the family. Tahmina wants her children to have a computer and to live in a house where they have cushioned furniture. She is asking for a loan of 5,000 somoni to buy a computer and furniture. She awaits your kindness.

loans.use: To buy a computer and furniture for her children

loans.name: Josefina

texts.en: Josefina is a beautician and manicurist within her locality. She is widowed and blessed with seven children. According to her, she was only 18 years old when she started working as manicurist. Josefina aspires to maintain her beauty salon business. That's the reason she is asking for another loan amounting to PHP 12,000. She will use this amount to buy chemicals for hair cold waves and for various kinds of nail polish (cutex) which will be used for her beauty salon business. Josefina is looking forward to continuous growth of her beauty salon business. In this way, she could sustain her family's needs and improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase chemicals for hair cold waves and for various kinds of nail polish (cutex) for her beauty salon business

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is 49 years old, married and supports seven people in her family. She and her spouse have been blessed with five children. She does dairy farming and she has been in the business for 17 years. 

She will be using the loan to buy farm inputs like fertilizer and animal feed for her dairy cattle. She will use the anticipated profits from her expanded business to repay the loan as well as educate her children.

This is her second loan term and in the future, she hopes to expand her dairy farming by having more dairy cows and also be a successful social  business lady.

loans.use: To buy feed for her dairy cattle and fertilizer.

loans.name: Riza

texts.en:
Riza is a well-experienced tailor providing a tailoring service business in a rental place in town. She lives in Bayan-Ulgii province of Mongolia with her husband and three children in her small house. Her husband Hairat is a driver and currently unemployed. Her three children are local high and primary school students respectively.

Riza learned tailoring when she was 25 and tailored her family's clothes and worked in a local construction company as an assistant worker. She attended the public tailoring and small business management training in 2010 and was granted a tailoring machine. She started her tailoring service business in a rental place then. She is now requesting a loan of 1,500,000 MNT to purchase inventory and some winter preparation goods for her business and her family. She is a hardworking, responsible and reticent woman.

loans.use: to purchase inventory and some winter preparation goods

loans.name: Innocente

texts.fr: Innocente est une jeune dame de 32ans. Elle a épousé un soudeur et ils ont 04enfants dont 03 scolarisés. Au bord de la route, elle revend des biscuits, des produits de beauté et autres à toutes personnes dans le besoin. Avec son troisième crédit qu’elle sollicite à WAGES, elle va s’approvisionner en marchandises pour pouvoir répondre aux besoins de ses clients.  Elle veut rendre son activité pérenne et avoir une bonne condition de vie.
texts.en: Innocente is a 32-year-old woman. She is married to a welder, and they have four children, three of which are in school. On the roadside, she sells cookies and beauty products to anyone in need of them. With the third loan she is requesting from WAGES, she is going to stock up on merchandise in order to better meet her customers' needs. She wants to make her business sustainable and to have good living conditions.

loans.use: to buy biscuits and cosmetic products for resale

loans.name: Ayda Aracely

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal Por Un Nuevo Amanecer se reúne cada quince días en Cantón Montecristi, conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla.
En este lugar vive la señora Aracely, tiene 54 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen tres hijos los mismos que ya son mayores de edad, pero aún viven en su casa. Su esposo es maestro.
Doña Aracely  tiene un local en el museo de la ciudad por el cual paga un arriendo, allí ella vende todo tipo de artesanía elaboradas en paja toquilla, cerámica, madera y varios materiales más, ella al igual que varias compañeras del lugar muchas veces realizan ferias ya sea en la misma ciudad o en otros cantones exponiendo sus productos y es así cuando mas venden, lo que más vende son los sombreros de paja toquilla ya estos son muy apreciados más que todo por los extranjeros que llegan hasta el lugar, lleva dos años con su local, ella compra las artesanías en la zona y también le traen de la sierra.
Este crédito es para surtir aún más su negocio, va a comprar toda clase de artesanías. Este es su tercer ciclo en el  Banco Comunal y le gusta porque los créditos son a muy bajos intereses. Sus sueños son tener su local propio.
texts.en:
The communal bank "Por un Nuevo Amanecer" meets every 15 days in the Montecristi Canton, which is known for its rich pre-colonial culture and crafts, on both a national and international level.  It is also kown for its famous straw hats.

Aracely, 54, lives here and is married and has three adult children who still live at home.  Her husband is a teacher.

Aracely rents a shop in the city museum where she sells all kinds of crafts made of straw, ceramic, wood and other materials.  She and her colleagues organize several fairs either in their own city or in other cantons so they can display and sell their products.  Straw hats are the most widely sold items since they are very popular among foreigners who visit the area.  She has been running her shop for two years.  She buys crafts in the area and also through people who bring them from the sierra mountain range.

This loan is to restock her business as she plans to buy all kinds of crafts.  This is her third loan in the communal bank and she likes the fact that the loans have very low interest rates.  Her dream is to have her own shop one day.

loans.use: To buy crafts.

loans.name: Carmen Valentina

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal Por Un Nuevo Amanecer se reúne cada quince días en Cantón Montecristi, conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla.
En este lugar vive la señora Carmen, tiene 31 años de edad, mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene dos hijos, de 13 y 6 años de edad, el mayor estudia en colegio y el menor en escuela. Su esposo es comerciante.
Doña Carmen es una muy buena madre y esposa que además de esto se dedica al comercio, vende zapatos por catálogos y productos de Avon, Lebel, Yanbal (perfumes, cremas, bisutería entre otras cosas), su forma de venta es puerta a puerta para lo cual que sale tres días por semana enseñando su revista y realizando sus pedidos mismos que luego entrega a crédito y cobra cada ocho días, ella lleva 6 años en este negocio y  le va muy bien.
Este crédito es para comprar cremas, perfumes, bisutería y zapatos. Lleva 3 años   en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque los créditos son rápidos y sin tantos requisitos. Sus sueños son darle lo mejor a sus hijos.
texts.en:
The communal bank "Por un Nuevo Amanecer" meets every 15 days in the Montecristi Canton which is known for its rich pre-colonial culture and its crafts, known on both a national and international level.  The place is also known for its famous straw hat.

This is where Carmen, 31, lives with her common-law husband and two children, ages 13 and 6.  The eldest is in middle school and the youngest is in grade school.  Her husband is a merchant.

Carmen is a good wife and mother, and works as a merchant selling shoes by catalogue and Avon, Lebel and Yanbal products (perfumes, creams, costume jewelry, etc.)  She sells door to door, showing her catalgoue, three days a week and delivers the goods on credit, collecting payment every eight days.  She has been in business for six years and it is going very well.

This loan is to buy creams, perfumes, costume jewelry and shoes.  She has been a member of the communal bank for three years and she likes the fact that the loans are quick and have few requirements.  Her dream is to give her children the best she can.

loans.use: To buy creams, perfumes, costume jewelry and shoes.

loans.name: Cecilia Marisol

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal Por Un Nuevo Amanecer se reúne cada quince días en Cantón Montecristi, conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla.
En este lugar vive la señora Cecilia, tiene 36 años de edad, mantiene una relación de unión libre y de esta relación tiene 4  hijos, de 17, 15, 12 y 9 años, los 3 mayores estudian en colegio y el menor en escuela, su marido es comerciante.
Doña Cecilia es una muy buena madre y esposa que para que a sus hijos no les falte nada  se dedica al comercio, vende ropa de todo tipo y productos de Belcorp (perfumes, cremas, bisutería entre otras cosas), su forma de venta es puerta a puerta para lo cual sale tres o cuatro días por semana ofreciendo sus productos, en ciertas ocasiones sus hijos le acompañan a vender cuando están desocupados, ella lleva 8 años en este negocio con el cual ayuda a sus hijos con los gastos que generan sus estudios lo cual es muy importante para ella.
Este crédito es para comprar ropa, cremas, perfumes y bisutería. Esta desde el inicio  en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque los créditos son de mucha ayuda para ella. Sus sueños son darle lo mejor a sus hijos.
texts.en:
The communal bank "Por un Nuevo Amanecer" meets every 15 days in the Montecristi Canton which is known for its rich pre-colonial culture and its crafts, known on both a national and international level. The place is also known for its famous straw hat.

This is where Cecilia, 36, lives with her common-law husband and their four children, ages 17, 15, 12 and 9.  The three eldest are in middle and high school and the youngest goes to elementary school.  Her husband is a merchant.

Cecilia is a good wife and mother who works as a merchant to support her children.  She sells all kinds of clothing and Belcorp products (perfumes, creams, costume jewelry, etc.).  She sells door to door and goes out three or four days a week offering her products.  Sometimes her children go with her if they are not busy.   For eight years she has been in business and helping her children cover their education costs, which is very important to her.

This loan is to buy clothing, creams, perfumes and costume jewelry.  She has been a member of the communal bank since the beginning and she likes the loans because they are of much help to her.  Her dream is to give her children the best she can.

loans.use: To buy clothing, creams, perfumes and costume jewelry.

loans.name: Genito Ramón

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal Por Un Nuevo Amanecer se reúne cada quince días en Cantón Montecristi, conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla.
En este lugar vive Don Genito, tiene 39 años de edad, está soltero y vive en  casa de los padres, lleva 5 años en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque gracias a los créditos el financia su negocio.
El Señor Genito es un hombre muy trabajador que le gusta ganar lo suyo honradamente, el se dedica al comercio, vende ropa de todo tipo y su forma de venta es puerta a puerta, también se desplaza hasta los campos lugares donde tiene muchos clientes que siempre le compran, allí deja su mercadería a crédito la misma que cobra cada ocho días,  lleva más de 5 años en este negocio el cual le permite ayudar a sus padres con los gastos de la casa.
Este crédito es para comprar pantalones, blusas y otras prendas que vende. Sus sueños son seguir adelante y tener un carro para ir a realizar sus ventas.
texts.en:
The communal bank "Por un Nuevo Amanecer" meets every 15 days in the Montecristi Canton which is known for its rich pre-colonial culture and its crafts, known on both a national and international level. The place is also known for its famous straw hat.

This is where Genito, 39 and single, lives with his parents.  He has been a member of the communal bank for five years and likes the fact that he can finance his business thanks to the loans.

Genito is a hard-working man who likes to earn an honest living.  He sells all kinds of clothing on a door-to-door basis.  He also goes out in the country where there are customers who always buy from him.  He leaves the merchandise on credit and collects payment every eight days.  For over five years he has been in this business which has allowed him to help his parents cover household expenses.

He will use the loan to buy pants, blouses and other clothing articles.  His dream is to prosper and buy a car one day for his sales activity.

loans.use: To buy pants, blouses and other clothing.

loans.name: Blanca Azucena

texts.es: Blanca, tiene 54 años de edad, es madre soltera, tiene un hijo y vive en el municipio de San Pedro Sula junto a su hijo, nuera y nieto. Ella inicio su propio negocio hace muchos años donde elabora  tortillas de harina, esta actividad la realiza en su casa y tiene sus clientes fijos. El préstamo que solicita es por 4,000 Lempiras y lo va invertir en la compra de harina, manteca, huevos, leche, fermi pan y soda para la elaboración de tortillas. Su objetivo es que su negocio crezca en clientes y poder mantenerlo como su única fuente de ingresos.
texts.en:
Blanca, 54, is a single mother with a son.  She lives in the municipality of San Pedro Sula with her son, daughter-in-law and grandson.  A few years ago she started a flour tortilla business which she carries out from home and has fixed customers.  

She is requesting a loan in the amount of 4,000 HNL to buy flour, shortening, eggs, milk, yeast and soda to make tortillas.  Her goal is to expand her business and increase her client base so she can continue her work which is her only source of income.

loans.use: To buy flour, shortening, eggs, yeast, milk and soda to make tortillas to sell.

loans.name: Tadeo

texts.en:
Tadeo used the previous loan to buy general merchandise to sell. He is a 38-year-old married man with four children, living in Kagadi, Uganda. He operates a retail business, which he started with savings from agriculture. He began this business to improve his standard of living and that of his family. 

Price fluctuation, high cost of rent and license fees are his major challenges, while his dream is to trade in wholesale. Tadeo intends to use the loan to buy soda, sugar and salt to sell.

loans.use: to buy soda, sugar, and salt to sell.

loans.name: Dorcas

texts.en:
Dorcas is 37 years old, married and together with her spouse they have been blessed with three children. She has a retail shop and has been in the business for three years. 

She will be using the loan to add stock of goods like sugar, rice, cooking fat, flour and salt to sell. She will use the anticipated profits from her expanded business to educate her children.

This is her first loan term. Her hopes in the future are to have a bigger shop and to educate her children up to tertiary level.

loans.use: to buy more stock of goods to sell.

loans.name: Mwanaidi

texts.en:
Mwanaidi is a single woman who has one child, and she owns a house that has no piped water and electricity. Her greatest monthly expense is food.
 
She has operated a tailoring business for the past four years. Mwanaidi makes women suits and men suits. Her potential clients are ladies and gents. She dreams of establishing a boutique in the future. 

With the KES 40,000 she wants to purchase cloth and sewing thread for her business. She decided to join Yehu to access financial support to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase cloth and sewing thread for her business.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is 53 years old and married with four children.

Jocelyn works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 6,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

She has been running the general store for two years and also earns an income from food-vending.

Jocelyn aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Joshua

texts.en:
Joshua is 25 years old and single. He has a water business where he supplies water to customers within Kitengela town. Joshua has been in this business for three years and he makes a monthly income of KES 8,000.

He plans to use this amount to buy water tanks and water pipes. This will enable him to serve more customers as well as generate more profits. He plans to use the anticipated profits to buy more water tanks.

This is his third loan term having paid back all the previous loans successfully. In future, Joshua hopes to grow his business and have a happy and successful life.

loans.use: To buy water tanks and pipes.

loans.name: Ma. Jessica

texts.en:
Ma. Jessica works hard to support her family. Ma. Jessica is married and has a dried fish vending business in the Philippines.

Ma. Jessica requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more dried fish to sell to her customers.

Ma. Jessica has been in this business for 6 years now.

In the future, Ma. Jessica would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase more dried fish to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Rosa Maribel

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Tosagua cada quince días se reúne el Banco Comunal Las Progresistas, este lugar se lo conoce por ser muy dinámico donde la mayoría de sus habitantes se dedican a la agricultura y a la cría de animales, por ser una zona con gran vegetación.
En este lugar vive la señora Rosa, tiene 44 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene 9  hijos, cinco son mayores de edad, los menores aun viven en su casa y  estudian en colegio y escuela. El marido se dedica a la agricultura. 
Doña Rosa como buena esposa que es realiza el crédito para que su esposo lo utilice en sus faenas en el campo, el con la ayuda de sus hijos siembran  distintos productos en toda época del año ya que cuentan con lo necesario para regar los cultivos, ellos siembran tomate, pimiento, melón, sandias, verduras y muchos otros frutos y hortalizas que se cultivan en esta zona, así mismo ellos una vez lista la cosecha entregan a comerciantes que llegan hasta el lugar a comprar sus productos.
Este crédito es para comprar abonos y químicos para así tener una muy buena cosecha. Tiene 4 años en el Banco Comunal y le gusta por la ayuda que le brindan los créditos. Sus sueños son darle lo mejor a su familia.
texts.en:
In the city of Tosagua the Las Progresistas communal bank meets every two weeks. This place is well known for being dynamic. Most of its inhabitants work in agriculture and raising animals, because it is a place with a lot of vegetation.

This is where Rosa lives. She is 44 years old and is in a common law marriage from which she has 9 children. Five of them are grown and the younger ones still live in her house and go to elementary and high school. Her husband works in agriculture. Rosa, like the good wife that she is, is taking out this loan so her husband can use it for his farming work. With the help of their children he will plant different products all year round, because they have the means to irrigate the crops. They plant tomatoes, peppers, melon, watermelon, greens and many other products and produce that are grown in this area. One the harvest is ready, they deliver it to merchants who go there to buy their products. 

This loan is to buy fertilizer and chemicals to have a very good harvest. She has been in the communal bank for four years and she likes it because of the help that the loans are. Her dreams are to give the best to her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and chemicals.

loans.name: Krishne

texts.en: Krishne is 42 years old and has a family with three school-aged children. The family of Krishne depends on the income from rice cultivation. Krishne was formerly financing his input through his paddy buyer who was charging high interest rates and offered low prices. Since the arrival of Seva MFI he is not dependent on his buyer and he can save more money through his rice production. He repaid his previous loan fully. With the profits of last season Krishne bought a second-hand tractor. He has applied for a new loan of SRD 7000 to purchase pesticides and fertilizers.

loans.use: To purchase pesticides and fertilizers.

loans.name: Soeradj

texts.en:
Soeradj is 40 years old and lives with his wife, two children and parents.  He recently inherited a rice field from his father who is aging and retired.   

Soeradj has been doing business with Seva MFI since 2010 and took several loans that were all repaid on time.  He asks for a new loan of 10,000 SRD for the purchase of fertilizers and pesticides for his rice production.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and pesticides for his rice production.

loans.name: Roopchand

texts.en:
Roopchand is 53 years old, and he has a family with two school-aged children. 

Roopchand lost his parents while young, and as the oldest son he was entrusted with the task of taking care of the small rice business of his father. He also took care of his younger brothers and sisters. 

With the arrival of Seva MFI, Roopchand invested in his rice areas, and now he sells his crop as seed, which provides him with a bigger margin. 

He repaid his loan fully, and now he needs a new loan of SRD 10,000 to purchase fertilizer and pesticides.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer and pesticides.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase seeds, fertilizer, and pesticides.

loans.name: Rudradew

texts.en: Rudradew is 26 years old and recently married. He still lives with his parents and does rice cultivation together with his father. With the support of Seva MFI Rudradew bought a second-hand pickup truck which he use to provide transportation services during harvest season. He has repaid this loan fully and now he wants to save for a tractor. Therefore he has expanded his rice areas and applied for a new loan of SRD 10,000 to purchase fertilizers and pesticides.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers and pesticides.

loans.name: Prewesh

texts.en: Prewesh is 25 years old and lives with his parents and two school-aged sisters. After finishing his secondary school he took over his father's company. Prewesh is now the main breadwinner at home and besides rice cultivation he breeds cows. With the support of Seva MFI he bought a secondhand tractor and repaid his loan fully. His goal is to save for the education of his two sisters. He asks Seva MFI for a new loan of SRD 10,000 for the purchase of fertilizer and pesticides for his rice production.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer and pesticides for his rice production.

loans.name: Muzaffar

texts.en:
Mr. Muzaffar is a 48-year-old man who lives with his family in Lahore, Pakistan. Since 2005, Muzaffar has been running his own clothing business, which is a very successful business for his family. He is an active borrower of BRAC Pakistan. He sells a variety of ladies and gents un-stitched clothes in the market. 

He has old stock in his shop, due to which his number of customers and sales are decreasing day-by-day.  

Therefore he wants to replace the old stock of his shop with new stock. For that he has requested a loan for from Kiva's partner, BRAC Pakistan to purchase new varieties of ladies and gents clothings. This will help him to attract customers and to increase his sales and income. He is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to purchase a new variety of ladies and gents clothings.

loans.name: Parmanand

texts.en:
Parmanand is 47 years old, and he has a family with two school-aged children. 

He is a dedicated rice farmer, but during off seasons he cultivates other agricultural produce, such as bananas and watermelons (for extra income). Together with his wife they are working and saving for their future and for the education of their children. 

With the support of Seva MFI, Parmanand bought a pick-up truck to transport his harvested crops (and those of his colleague farmers) to the mills. Meanwhile Parmanand fully repaid that loan, as per plan.

He needs a new loan of SRD 10,000 to purchase fertilizer and pesticides for his rice production.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer and pesticides for his rice produduction.

loans.name: Juvita

texts.en:
A loan of $ 600 is offered to Juvita to improve her business. She is married and she has four children. She has a kiosk where many people come to buy every day. She will buy some additional supplies such as noodles, cigarettes, shampoo, onions, garlic and biscuits. She has been involving herself in business activities since 2002. She feels so happy running her business because she can earn money every day.

Running a business has made Juvita independent because she can be responsible for herself and also help her family. She hopes to run a bigger business in the future.

loans.use: To buy noodles, cigarettes, shampoo, onions, garlic and biscuits

loans.name: Herlan

texts.es:
Herlan es soltero de 28 años, nació en Santa Rosa provincia Luis Calvo del departamento de Chuquisaca – Bolivia desea cursar el Diplomado en Gerencia de Proyectos en Desarrollo de Software en la Unidad de Postgrado de Ciencias de la Computación de la Universidad Autónoma Gabriel Rene Moreno como modalidad de titulación especial para su Carrera de Ingeniería en Informática, motivo por el cual requiere un Crédito de EDUCA-PRÓ para terminar de financiar sus Estudios.

Herlan trabaja en la Gobernación de Santa Cruz como Encargado de Sistemas. Vive con su familia y no tiene otros ingresos económicos, ni actividades extra académicas. Su mayor motivación es salir profesional puesto que sus padres solo pudieron terminar la primaria. 

A Herlan le va bien en lo que hace pues declara que siempre le gustó mucho todo lo referente con la tecnología, y aunque los obstáculos siempre han existido, actualmente trabaja en lo que le gusta y solo espera poder titularse muy pronto con la ayuda del financiamiento. 

Aunque Herlan se encuentra trabajando, necesita una ayuda económica para poder cubrir este diplomado y asimismo titularse, pues tiene la esperanza que a partir de ello podrá optar por otro trabajo donde perciba mayores ingresos económicos de los que percibe ahora. El piensa que lo que le diferencia de otros postulantes es las ganas de superación que tiene para salir adelante, teniendo como único obstáculo el tener que trabajar y estudiar paralelamente. 

Herlan se encuentra muy contento y agradecido con las personas que generosamente ayudan a otros como él, para salir adelante.
texts.en:
Herlan, 28, is single. He was born in Santa Rosa, Luis Calvo province, Chuquisaca department, in Bolivia. He wants to take a diploma degree in Software Development Projects Management at the Computer Sciences Postgraduate Unit of Universidad Autónoma Gabriel Rene Moreno. This will be a specialization track in his Computer Engineering studies. This is why he is requesting a loan at EDUCAPRÓ to pay for his studies.

Herlan works for the Government of Santa Cruz as the person in charge of ICT systems. He lives with his family and this is his only source of income. He does not have other activities besides his studies. His main motivation is to become a professional, considering that his parents could only study up to primary school.

Herlan is good at what he does. He says that he always liked everything related to technology. Despite the obstacles, he is doing what he likes to do and is hoping to get his degree soon with the help of this loan. Although Herlan works, he needs financial support to cover the cost of this degree. He hopes that this will result in more job opportunities and a higher income than the current one.

He believes that what makes him special compared to other candidates is his will to progress and get ahead. The only obstacle he has is that he has to work and study at the same time. Herlan feels happy and grateful to those who so kindly help him and others like him to get ahead.

loans.use: to pay for his studies in Software Development Projects Management.

loans.name: Jagdies

texts.en:
Jagdies is 46 years old, and has a family with two school-aged children.

He has been cultivating rice since his youth, and depends on his family to work the farming. Jagdies is trying to save for his own tractor through his rice production. 

Therefore, he has expanded his rice areas, and needs a loan of SRD 10,000 to purchase pesticides and fertilizer.

loans.use: To purchase pesticides and fertilizer.

loans.name: Evelyn Yamary

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal Primero De Abril se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Montecristi, conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla.
En este lugar vive la señora Evelyn, tiene 33 años de edad, está casada y fruto de esta relación tiene dos hijos de 16 y 14 años que estudian  en colegio. Su esposo es maestro artesano. 
Doña Evelyn es una muy buena esposa que realiza el crédito para que el esposo lo utilice en su trabajo, el tiene un taller de aluminio y vidrio, allí el junto a un ayudante elaboran puertas, ventanas y varios obras más con estos materiales, trabajan de lunes a sábado casi todo el día, ella por su parte se dedica a la vende ropa de todo tipo, el cual lo realiza en sus momentos que está desocupada.  La mayor parte del crédito es para el taller el cual su esposo lo tiene por más de 17 años y con el cual ha sacado adelante a su familia.
Este crédito es para comprar aluminio, vidrio y otros materiales que utiliza su esposo en su taller. Está en el Banco Comunal desde el inicio y le gusta por la ayuda que le brindan los créditos. Sus sueños son darles lo mejor a sus hijos y que ellos sean buenos profesionales.
texts.en:
The "Primero de Abril" communal bank meets every fortnight in the Montecristi canton, an area known for its rich, pre-colonial culture, and for its artisan products that are recognised both nationally and internationally.  It is also from here that the famous Panama hat originates.

And it is here that 33-year-old Evelyn lives.  She is married and has two children, aged 16 and 14 years old each.  They are both studying in school, while Evelyn's husband is an artisan craftsman.

Evelyn is a very good wife and is taking out this loan to support her husband in his work.  He has an aluminium and glass workshop and, there, with an assistant, he produces doors, windows, and other pieces of work with these materials.  Evelyn's husband works from Monday to Saturday, almost all day long.  Evelyn, herself, makes a living selling all kinds of clothes when she has spare time.  Most of this loan will go to the workshop, which Evelyn's husband has had for over 17 years.  With it, he has helped the family to prosper.

This loan will be used to buy aluminium, glass, and other materials that Eveyln's husband needs.  Evelyn has been with the communal bank from the beginning and she likes the help which is provided through loans.  Evelyn's dream is to give her children the best she can, and to see them become professionals.

loans.use: to buy aluminium, glass, and other materials.

loans.name: Brian

texts.en:
Brian is 30 years old and married; he supports three members of his family. Brian has been in the Kabarnet area for a period of two years, running his electrical goods shop, which enables him to earn an income of KES 10,000 monthly.

He is now servicing his third loan of KES 35,000 from KADET LTD and intends to use this amount to purchase more electrical goods for resale. The profits he earns will be used to repay the loan and expand his current business.

His dream is to live happily and expand his business.

loans.use: To purchase electrical goods for his shop.

loans.name: Mercy Marina

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal Primero De Abril se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Montecristi, conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla.
En este lugar vive la señora Mercy,  tiene 48 años de edad, es madre soltera de un hijo, el cual tiene 15 años de edad y estudian en colegio. Ella vive con su hijo y una hermana que también es soltera.
Doña Mercy es una mujer muy luchadora que le gusta trabajar honradamente para sacar adelante a su hijo, ella se dedica a la venta de productos Avon (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas), además en su casa ella también se dedica a la venta de carbón, material que es muy utilizado por los negocios de comida,  trabaja todos los días ya sea en su casa o realizando sus recorridos, deja su mercadería a crédito y cobra cada fin de semana, lleva en este negocio por más de 3 años con la cual saca sola adelante a su hijo.
Este crédito es para comprar perfumes, cremas y cosméticos. Está en el Banco Comunal desde hace 3 años y le gusta por la ayuda que le dan con los créditos. Sus sueños es darle la mejor educación a su hijo.
texts.en:
The Primero De Abril communal bank meets every two weeks in the Montecristi canton, known for its rich pre-colonial history and its handmade crafts, recognized nationally and internationally. It is the home of the famous paja toquilla hats.

This is where Mercy lives. She is 48 years old and the single mother of one son. He is 15 and in high school. She lives with her son and a sister who is also single. Mercy is a woman who is really a fighter and she likes to work honestly to get her son ahead. She sells Avon products (beauty products, cosmetics, perfumes and women's accessories). In addition, she also sells charcoal from her house. It is used in food businesses. She works every day either in her house or as a street vendor. She sells her merchandise on credit and collects every weekend. She has had this business for more than 3 years and with it she gets her son ahead. 

This loan is to buy perfumes, creams and cosmetics. She has been in the communal bank for 3 years and she likes it because of the help they give her through the loans. Her dreams are to give her son the best education.

loans.use: to buy perfumes, creams and cosmetics.

loans.name: Caroline

texts.en: Caroline has a tailoring business that she has been running for five years now. She is 26 years old and married. She and her spouse have been blessed with 1 child. She plans to use this loan to buy textile materials for sewing, threads, and buttons. She will use the generated income to buy more textile materials. This will be her first loan term and she hopes to have a successful business in the future.

loans.use: To buy material, threads, and buttons.

loans.name: Walter Miguel

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal Primero De Abril se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Montecristi, conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla.
En este lugar vive el Señor Walter, el tiene 34 años de edad, está casado y fruto de esta relación tiene tres hijos 19, 18 y 16 años, los dos menores  estudian en colegio. Su esposa es ama de casa. 
Don Walter se dedica a la venta de  frutas y verduras, trabaja todos los días desde las  05h00 hasta las 14h00, el se desplaza en su carro desde la madrugada hasta el mercado mayorista en Portoviejo para comprar los mejores productos para poder ofrecerles a sus clientes, luego recorre la ciudad y ciertos sitios cercanos vendiendo estos alimentos indispensables para el diario vivir, tiene 18 años que se dedica a esta actividad con la cual saca a su familia adelante gracias a su trabajo honrado.
Este crédito es para comprar frutas y legumbres. Lleva tres años en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque los créditos son de gran ayuda para financiar su negocio. Sus sueños son comprar otro carro ya que el que tiene está un poco deteriorado.
texts.en:
The "Primero de Abril" communal bank meets every fortnight in the Montecristi canton, an area known for its rich, pre-colonial culture, and for its artisan products that are recognised both nationally and internationally.  It is also from here that the famous Panama hat originates.

And it is here that 34 year old Walter lives.  He is married and has three children, aged, 19, 18, and 16 years old.  The two youngest are in school.  Walter's wife is a housewife.

Walter makes a living selling fruits and vegetables, working every day from 5am until 2pm.  He goes out with his carr early in the morning to the wholesale market in Portoviejo.  There he buys the best products to offer to his customers and then he goes out to nearby places to sell these essential products.  Walter has been doing this work for 18 years and, with this decent work, he is helping his family to prosper.

Walter will use this loan to buy fruits and vegetables.  He has been with the communal bank for three years and likes it because the loans have been a great help to him to finance his business.  Walter's dream is to buy another cart as the one he has now is a little deteriorated.

loans.use: to buy fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Karina Fernanda

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal Primero De Abril se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Montecristi, conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla.
En este lugar vive la señora Karina, tiene 21 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre y aun no tiene hijos. El marido es comerciante. 
Doña Karina es una joven ama de casa que además de estar atenta en el cuidado de su hogar también se dedica al comercio,  ella vende ropa por catálogos y productos Yanbal (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas), su forma de venta es puerta a puerta, trabaja todos los días por horas, ella deja a crédito su mercadería y cobra cada 8 días, lleva más de 2 años dedicada a este negocio el cual le permite ayudar a su marido a salir adelante. 
Este crédito es para comprar ropa y productos Yanbal. Está en el Banco Comunal desde hace 2 años y le gusta porque con el primer crédito empezó su negocio. Sus sueños son tener su casa propia ya que donde viven es arrendado.
texts.en:
The "Primero de Abril" communal bank meets every fortnight in the Montecristi canton, an area known for its rich, pre-colonial culture, and for its artisan products that are recognised both nationally and internationally.  It is also from here that the famous Panama hat originates.

And it is here that 21-year-old Karina lives.  She has a partner but does not yet have any children.  Karina's husband is a businessman.

Karina is a housewife but, in addition to looking after the home, she sells clothes from catalogues, and Yanbal products (beauty products, make-up, perfumes, and women's accessories).  She sells door-to-door, working every day for some hours.  Karina sells her products on credit and collects payments ever week.  She has been doing this work for over two years, and it has helped her and her husband to prosper.

This loan will be used to buy clothes and Yanbal products.  Karina has been with the communal bank for two years and she likes it because, with her first loan, she started her business.  Karina's dream is to buy a house - she currently lives in a rented property.

loans.use: to buy clothes and Yanbal products.

loans.name: Ndawasa

texts.en:
Ndawasa does farming in Oloitoktok town where he plants cash crops for selling. He is 60 years old and married to Rodah and they have been blessed with 6 children. He has been in the farming business for 13 years and it has been profitable.

He plans to use this loan amount to buy more farm inputs for his farm. These include fertilizer and agrochemicals. This will enable him to harvest more farm produce and thereby generate more profits with which he will use to provide better education for his children.

This is his fourth loan term and he paid all the previous loans successfully. In future, he hopes to grow his farming business, make more income and be able to provide for the needs of his family.

loans.use: To buy farm inputs like fertilizer and agrochemicals.

loans.name: Marissa

texts.en:
Marissa, who is 41 years old, is married to a farmer and they are blessed with two children. She has sold a variety of grocery items in her store for almost 10 years and earns a net income of PHP 700 per day. Her profits are usually spent on their electric bill, food costs and school fees for their children. 

Due to a lack of capital, Marissa would like to request a loan to those generous lenders amounting to PHP 30,000 to purchase bread, beverages, food spices, noodles, canned goods and coffee to sell in her store. She's hoping that her requested loan will be granted so that she can improve and expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase bread, beverages, food spices, noodles, canned goods and coffee to sell in her store.

loans.name: Samanya

texts.en:
Samanya has been selling livestock in Oloitoktok and other towns for the last 18 years. He sells cows, goats and sheep. He is 44 years old and married. Together with his spouse they have been blessed with 6 children.

This is his third loan term. Samanya plans to buy more stock of cows, goats and sheep which he will sell at a profit. He will use the anticipated profits to educate his children. 

His future hopes and dreams are to provide good education for his children.

loans.use: to buy more cows, goats and sheep to sell.

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en:
Patrick is 39 years old from Naivasha. He is married to Josephine and they have seven children. 

Patrick is a farmer and has been farming for many years. He has applied for his first loan from KADET to enable him to buy fertilizers and seedlings to use on his farm.

He hopes to expand his business in the near future.

loans.use: to buy seedlings and fertilizers.

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en: Stephen is a married man with four children living in Kasese, Uganda. For four years, he has been operating a retail business in order to supplement his farming activities, which are seasonal. As a good father, he wants to educate his children up to the university level. He also wants to set up a number of sustainable income generating activities. Inadequate capital and customers not paying on time are major challenges to his efforts to set up a wholesale shop. Stephen is requesting a loan to buy soda and sugar to sell.

loans.use: to buy soda and sugar to sell.

loans.name: Estrella

texts.en:
Estrella is married with three children. She runs a retail store where she sells food and snacks in the terminal as an aid to her husband's income from farming. She has been doing this for more than three years. She always find ways to augment their living. 

Estrella has borrowed a loan from GDMPC to buy more snacks and beverages for sale. She is hopeful to own a food court in the terminal in order to provide convenient and comfortable services to her customers. She wants to improve the general living standards of her family in the near future.

loans.use: to buy more snacks and beverages for sale.

loans.name: Mwanamkasi

texts.en:
